commit_message:
Change create flavor to use default arguments

Most of the arguments required by the create flavor API can have
reasonable defaults and therefore can be made optional in the CLI.
This brings create flavor in line with the documented args in the
wiki at https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/UnifiedCLI/Mapping#flavor

Change-Id: Iecb3baf72f9dc3981742ff7989780894e37921c9

commit_message:
NetApp doc addition for volume filtering.

This change adds on the documentation
for the additional option added to fix
bug  1132834 meant to support volume filtering
in 7 mode direct driver.
Implemented code review changes.

Change-Id: I47fb619fd62350a753c8bc313469e6272796a11b

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-07 20:46:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add a dependency on openssl.

Nova and Keystone use openssl to setup certificates.  If it's not
there then Keystone fails with "Error 2: No such file or directory",
Nova fails with "openssl: command not found" and glance fails with
"glance: error: argument --os-auth-token: expected one argument"
Basically, cascading errors everywhere.  So I put the dependency
in "general" since it affects multiple packages.

Fixes bug 1152315

Change-Id: I803f91644443d7aba78c0a90384e32f6eece36ec
'}]
commit_message:
Add a dependency on openssl.

Nova and Keystone use openssl to setup certificates.  If it's not
there then Keystone fails with "Error 2: No such file or directory",
Nova fails with "openssl: command not found" and glance fails with
"glance: error: argument --os-auth-token: expected one argument"
Basically, cascading errors everywhere.  So I put the dependency
in "general" since it affects multiple packages.

Fixes bug 1152315

Change-Id: I803f91644443d7aba78c0a90384e32f6eece36ec

[{'created': '2013-02-21 16:34:52.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid vm instance shutdown when power state is NOSTATE

* nova/compute/manager.py (_sync_power_states): Log the condition
where we can retrieve the state from the hyperviser, rather than
stopping the VM.

Related grizzly commits are 95e77703 and ad101ce5

Fixes bug: 1085771
Change-Id: I5fb9fdc6bcde729c00c4931960ed0de3b8fa189d
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid vm instance shutdown when power state is NOSTATE

* nova/compute/manager.py (_sync_power_states): Log the condition
where we can retrieve the state from the hyperviser, rather than
stopping the VM.

Related grizzly commits are 95e77703 and ad101ce5

Fixes bug: 1085771
Change-Id: I5fb9fdc6bcde729c00c4931960ed0de3b8fa189d

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-06 15:41:51.000000000', 'message': "Fixed image filter support for vmware

The vmware compute driver does not support the image filter
based on hypervisor_type. In a heterogeneous environment,
this filter attribute allows us to provision an instance
to a specific hypervisor based on the property of the
glance image. The solution is to populate the dictionary
'supported_instances' from the vmware compute driver.

Fix for bug 1131542

Change-Id: I6ebf9f0d4a17b3083f66f69f077f910552d9a951
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed image filter support for vmware

The vmware compute driver does not support the image filter
based on hypervisor_type. In a heterogeneous environment,
this filter attribute allows us to provision an instance
to a specific hypervisor based on the property of the
glance image. The solution is to populate the dictionary
'supported_instances' from the vmware compute driver.

Fix for bug 1131542

Change-Id: I6ebf9f0d4a17b3083f66f69f077f910552d9a951

commit_message:
Do not accept invalid keys in quota-update

Check if the keys are valid and respond with HTTPBadRequest
when they are not.

Fix for LP# 1064864

Change-Id: I5ca6e0114b583dd898125e19d8f029cc24e4bc32

commit_message:
Add tests to validate REST path to action mapping.

The Routes mapping performs some brittle regexp manipulation
to build the parameter mapping on the path, so its nice to validate
that it is doing what is expected.

Supports bug #1131759

Change-Id: I251178c2bd9cb03fcedc2da7ea31378b62ae309f

'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2013-03-07 09:27:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

There are some inconsistencies here:

- In several places, you're using resource_id_set() to store a resource ID, then later using FnGetRefId to retrieve it, which will obviously work, but FnGetRefId is not defined to return self.resource_id in all heat resources (several override it), so it makes sense to me to avoid this pattern and just read self.resource_id, since that's the value you set.

- Several resources store a single resource ID into self.metadata - these IDs are directly related to the resource in most cases, so should these values not also be converted to be stored into self.resource_id too (seems aligned with the aim of this patch?)"}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-03-07 21:57:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-03-07 21:59:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I've reduced a bit what is stored in metadata:
- NetworkInterface now uses the port id as its resource_id
- Subnet already has the network_id in its properties

The remaining metadata is either to store the IDs of encapsulated resources
(eg, a VPC is a quantum net with an associated encapsulated router)
or to keep track of the relationships between the underlying quantum
resources.

Also, FnGetRefId() is no longer called"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-07 22:05:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23391/6/check/gate-heat-pep8/2385 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/23391/6/check/dev-heat-coverage/1000 : SUCCESS (non-voting)

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-08 10:32:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: No score

commit_message:
Use quantum IDs for VPC, Subnet, RouteTable resources

Previously the resource IDs were the resource names
so an already existing quantum entity cannot be passed into a
template.

Fixes: bug #1142812

Change-Id: I9ea6561674d88dbbdd82b7c69400a70c529c4525

commit_message:
Wrap quota controller with resource.Resource

Fixes bug 1116137

Currently the format of error message returned by quota extension was
different with quantum other resource. Other resource will return as
json(eg, '{"QuantumError": "error message"}'). But quota extension only
return messages without any format.
'quantum.api.v2.resource.Resource' provider error messages processing.
So wrap quota controller with it.

By the way, fix some small stuff:
* Use specific exception 'QuotaTenantNotFound' instead of generic exception.
* Correct error message.
* Use attribute mapping checking the request body.

Change-Id: I71261198aa79e9ed8e0ae672de32552abdbf45c1

This patch is really doing three things, so ideally I'd prefer to see it broken up into three patches - only a minor nitpick really but a good habit to get into, and it makes reviewing much easier, ie lots of small changes, clearly described in the log message.

1 - HupConfig hooks dict to list
2 - CommandRunner reference properties not variables
3 - Improve coverage of CommandRunner, HupConfig, ServicesHandler

I think adding test coverage is great, but generally we should try to keep new tests associated with the logical changes in the patch, and adding tests just to improve coverage should be a separate patch (so we keep the tests if we have to revert the bugfix patch for any reason)"}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:54:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:55:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

[{'created': '2013-03-08 07:48:10.000000000', 'message': 'Allow to specify a layout for the disk

A file can be passed as an argument to disk-image-create with the -l switch
and create an specific hard disk layout.

The formant of this file (with one partition per line) is:

/mount_point BEGIN END FS

Where BEGIN and END follow the specifications of parted (
http://www.gnu.org/software/parted/manual/parted.html#unit)

FS can be ext4 and xfs

Example:
/ 4096kib 2GB ext4
/data 2GB -512MB xfs
/cache -512MB 100% ext4

ToDo: It has a limit of 4 primary partitions. No logical ones are allowed for now.

commit_message:
(DRAFT) Allow to specify a layout for the disk

A file can be passed as an argument to disk-image-create with the -l switch
and create an specific hard disk layout.

The formant of this file (with one partition per line) is:

/mount_point BEGIN END FS

Where BEGIN and END follow the specifications of parted (
http://www.gnu.org/software/parted/manual/parted.html#unit)

FS can be ext4 and xfs

Example:
/ 4096kib 2GB ext4
/data 2GB -512MB xfs
/cache -512MB 100% ext4

ToDo: It has a limit of 4 primary partitions. No logical ones are allowed for now.

Change-Id: I52d3756b80bf9b6c76206dfec32c426fad60e9ad

commit_message:
Allow probe-create to specify device_owner.

The device owner of the probe port can be
specified by the --device-owner option.

There are two values for device-owner option,
network or compute.

The probe port will be created with the network
as the device owner by default.

Fixes: bug #1102726

Change-Id: I72d62e2fe7b8f7a5eb4411bc9052efa82fb4fdf5

commit_message:
BareMetal driver to use current nova.network.model

* Updated tests to use classes from nova.network.model instead of legacy
  "network,mapping" tuple.
* Modified baremetal/{driver,pxe,vif_driver}.py to use classes from
  nova.network.model instead of legacy "network,mapping" tuple.

Change-Id: I8b4efa4bfb804c658b29d80373d9d0e4572b8e20
Fixes: bug 1112642

subject: Testcase for Nova VM Lifecycle
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-01-31 16:29:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/20901/1/check/gate-tempest-pep8/1840 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20901/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/311 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20901/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/140 : FAILURE (non-voting)
- http://logs.openstack.org/20901/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/3964 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/20901/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum-full/98 : FAILURE (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2013-01-31 18:40:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

These are incredibly state dependent tests and have no means to identify the false positive failures that will occur after a legitimate test failure. Still, even though all of these calls are tested independently, there could be some value in a separate scenario that is not part of normal smoke/gating tests, but it needs to handle failures gracefully"}, {'account_id': 1839, 'date': '2013-02-01 03:45:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

My Understanding is that you would like to have the scenario based test in Tempest but not as a part of smoke or gating tests. Also you want to ensure that there are no failures in the test due to one of the test step failing. 

I understand, this test does not run as  a part of Gating as of today. Also the tests do an assertFail() if any of the test step fails and there is a common teardownclass() which takes care of cleaning up the resources that are created. Please correct me if I am wrong.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-02 12:31:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

agree with Daryl, something like this needs to not be in the main gate, as written it would also be impossible to debug, and leave resources all over the place if something failed.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-02-10 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

'}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-02-14 17:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2013-02-15 12:23:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Perhaps I missed the QA meeting that suggested setting up a non-gating folder, but I don't agree with that suggestion at all.

There are two reasons I feel this way:

a) "non-gating" doesn't describe what the tests do

b) The way to not gate on specific tests is to decorate certain tests with an @testtools.attr decorator that can be used by a test runner to filter out certain tests.

So, I would much prefer to see tests added to the /tempest/tests/compute/servers directory and either:

1) Placed into a /tempest/tests/compute/servers/lifecycle directory (that can be then excluded by runners such as nosetests (using --exclude or --ignore-files)

2) Decorated with @testtools.attr("lifecycle") and then the upstream gate scripts can filter them out based on attrs.'}, {'account_id': 1795, 'date': '2013-02-15 22:49:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Agree with Jay. Folder name can be vm_lifecycle under tempest/tests/compute and have decorator lifecycle"}, {'account_id': 1921, 'date': '2013-02-16 09:00:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Jay, during the QA meeting on 07/02 we discussed that:
- how to handle non-gating tests is a broad topic, to be discussed at the Havana summit
- in the mean time we should not include anything non-gating in the main tempest folder

Unfortunately the log for that meeting is missing, so someone correct me if I got it wrong, please.

The approach you suggest sounds good to me, but to have a good way of maintaining tests suites then - i.e. what do we want to run as gating  - otherwise we'll end up modifying the gate script all the time we have non-gating tests: https://github.com/openstack-infra/devstack-gate/blob/master/devstack-vm-gate.sh

Now that we are running full gate, I think it's important we open tempest to the possibility of further non-gating tests; we could consider a "test incubator" job, which runs non-gating tests, and a process to promote non-gating to gating when applicable.'}, {'account_id': 1795, 'date': '2013-02-20 00:01:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Hi andrea-frittoli,

  Yes. The meeting log 2/7 could not be found.
But my understanding is that Sean and David suggested that non-gating tests like lifecycle can be checked-in into tempest like stress test by maintaining in a separate directory.
 
The lifecycle tests are still functional tests and hence need to go into a sub-folder under compute and those tests can be skipped by gate when we set attr.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-02-27 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-02-27 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

Testcase for Nova VM Lifecycle

inclusive of SSH verification

LGTM. Nice job with the tests'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-19 09:41:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

It seems like this same issue applies to many other parameters too - eg  disk_bus, cdrom_bus, vif_model and more in the future. Just handling individual properties seems doomed to failure - copy the entire properties dict over, and then merely override the few fields which need to be different (if any)"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-02-19 16:29:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

@danpb: makes sense to me, thanks!"}, {'account_id': 5371, 'date': '2013-02-19 18:10:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

architecture and hypervisor_type are special in that they are used by nova-scheduler for placement determination. More importantly, they are used by the default scheduler filters to do placement. If these aren't copied then unbootable instances from bad placement could be a result.

The other properties mentioned don't seem as critical to a working instance...?"}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-02-19 18:14:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

No that isn't correct. If a guest image is built to use e1000 NIC, and you ignore the glance vif_model property the guest can be given a virtio NIC by default instead. This will likely result in a non-functional guest. Likewise for disk / cdrom model."}, {'account_id': 5371, 'date': '2013-02-20 05:08:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I see. Those still seem to be specific to libvirt and not nova as a whole. Perhaps that is something for a future change?

I know this would definitely fix a problem with the powervm implementation currently.'}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-02-20 06:35:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

While I agree with what Dan is saying, I don't think we should block this particular fix because we have a larger issue with glance metadata.  This is a distinct bug which is being addressed with the facility we have in place for preserving specific metadata.  A generic solution is preferred but I think we can do that in a subsequent patch which implements the full solution and undoes all of the one-off metadata bits."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2013-02-20 17:39:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

I think this is sufficient; the suggested refactoring should be a separate review.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-02-24 18:50:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think Dan's objection is reasonable.  The patch is not a complete fix for the root problem of this code not copying all of the required attributes.  The suggested improvement to the patch is not that much more difficult and should be done now."}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2013-02-28 20:18:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

My thought is that we should have a clear method for determine which metadata keys must be unique, perhaps via namespace designation.  For example, maybe everything which is unique to an image is prefixed with "sys_".  Right now we just have to know which ones are safe to copy versus those which are not.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-03-01 00:18:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Copy hypervisor_type on snapshot

OpenStack manual encourages the addition of architecture and
hypervisor_type to the image metadata.  The architecture value already
is copied on snapshot, this patch adds support for hypervisor_type to
be copied.

Change-Id: I823aca7771669c0a97fd02e7f3235ad517943376

Add support for volume backup-to-swift

Matches support recently submitted to cinder.

Adds the commands: list-backup, show-backup, create-backup and
delete-backup

commit_message:
Merge small utility files

We had many very small files just with single utility function, in a
complex directory hierarchy.

tempest/common/ssh.py (1 class)
tempest/common/utils/linux/remote_client.py (1 class)
Moved to tempest/ssh.py

tempest/common/utils/* and tempest/tests/utils.py
Mostly one function files are moved to tempest/utils.py

Applying module import rules.

Change-Id: I44f607e94f52ed9eb0465761baf0ecd59b4b5b4e

[{'created': '2013-03-08 06:03:01.000000000', 'message': 'The change implements framework for configuring schedulers
for advanced services as well as simple scheduler for lbaas service

Implements: bp/quantum-service-scheduler

The patch introduces:
  - ServiceSchedulerManager: class responsible for loading
  schedulers for adv. services according to quantum.conf.
  It also provides top-level API for resource scheduling.
  - SchedulingAlgorithm - an algorithm to choose device from a
  list of devices provided by some device management object.
  Currently only trivial ChanceSchedulingAlgorithm is provided
  - PoolDeviceManager - class responsible for loading load balancer
  devices from conf file (in json format), updating device DB with it
  and managing associations between devices and resources.
  - DevicePoolScheduler - class that couples together a
  ChanceSchedulingAlgorithm and PoolDeviceManager.

  This infrastructure is to be used by plugin when performing CRUD
  operations.

Change-Id: I65b268550ad164aa13644bad93dcc852ed533a54
'}, {'created': '2013-03-08 06:03:01.000000000', 'message': 'The change implements framework for configuring
schedulers for advanced services as well as
simple scheduler for lbaas service

Implements: blueprint quantum-service-scheduler

The patch introduces:
  - ServiceSchedulerManager: class responsible for loading
  schedulers for adv. services according to quantum.conf.
  It also provides top-level API for resource scheduling.
  - SchedulingAlgorithm - an algorithm to choose device from a
  list of devices provided by some device management object.
  Currently only trivial ChanceSchedulingAlgorithm and
  RoundRobinSchedulingAlgorithm are provided, the latter is used.
  - PoolDeviceManager - class responsible for loading load balancer
  devices from conf file (in json format), updating device DB with it
  and managing associations between devices and resources.
  - DevicePoolScheduler - class that couples together a
  RoundRobinSchedulingAlgorithm and PoolDeviceManager.

  This infrastructure is to be used by plugin when performing CRUD
  operations.

commit_message:
The change implements Device Scheduler for LBaaS

Implements: blueprint quantum-service-scheduler

The patch introduces:
  - BalancerDeviceManager - class responsible for management load balancer
  devices, and associations between devices and resources.
  It also supports adding devices on demand.
  - BalancerScheduler - class that couples together
  SchedulingAlgorithm and BalancerDeviceManager.
  Scheduling algorithm chooses shared or private device with
  less associated resources.

  This infrastructure is to be used by plugin and device driver.

Change-Id: I65b268550ad164aa13644bad93dcc852ed533a54

commit_message:
Pull newly merged Olso update for 'is' operator

A recent update to common/scheduler/filters/extra_specs_ops.py in
Oslo added new 'is' operator to allow Boolean check. The original
commit message was:

"Boolean values for capabilities don't work because extra_specs are
all converted to unicode. The scheduler will then check, for example,
if the boolean 'True' is equal to the unicode string 'True', and will
always return False. This patch allows admins to specify '<is> True'
in extra_specs, which will compare successfully to boolean True."

Notice extra_specs_ops now relies on strutils from Olso, so this
change pull strutils from Oslo as well.

Fix bug: # 1146306

Change-Id: I83adf707c30274a3862aa8034e72c3361fd19952

commit_message:
NetApp bug fix for multibackend scenario.

The multibackend scenario using filter scheduler
did not work with NetApp drivers because of use
of FLAGS. Changed to use configuration to support
the multibackend scenario.

bug 1132637

Change-Id: I8ac5bd6d4269f703c3b3b0aa062c92f4412c25af

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-08 02:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23659/1/check/gate-quantum-pep8/5497 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/23659/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/12378 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-03-08 02:59:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I've looked at the blog entry pointed by Nachi.
httplib2 is patched as suggested in the example that shows how to reproduce the issue.

However, I think there's an easy way for having a distinct socket for each thread and avoiding the roundtrip to keystone.

If you look at the client code:

            if self.auth_token:
                kwargs.setdefault('headers', {})
                kwargs['headers']['X-Auth-Token'] = self.auth_token
            resp, body = self._cs_request(self.endpoint_url + url, method,
                                          **kwargs)
            return resp, body
        except exceptions.Unauthorized as ex:
            if not self.endpoint_url or self.token_retrieved:
                self.authenticate()
                if self.auth_token:
                    kwargs.setdefault('headers', {})
                    kwargs['headers']['X-Auth-Token'] = self.auth_token
                resp, body = self._cs_request(
                    self.endpoint_url + url, method, **kwargs)
                return resp, body
            else:
                raise ex

One could instantiate a client, retrieve a token from it and then pass it to get_instance. A new round-trip to keystone will happen only when that token expires.

Can this work?"}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-03-08 02:59:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

this will work, but I'd prefer to wait to merge until Mark has a chance to comment about the other solution he proposed, as his approach seems better if we can get it to work."}, {'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-03-08 02:59:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Dan

I tried Mark's suggestion, however it looks not working"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-08 02:59:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

'}]
commit_message:
add ns-metadata-proxy rootwrap filters to dhcp.filters

bug 1150628

now that dhcp-agent also uses ns-metadata-proxy, we need to make sure
those rootwrap filters are installed in scenarios where dhcp-agent is
installed by l3-agent is not.

Change-Id: I141b2291aceb93d650258ff1df1ef0122ce8da90

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-08 01:07:32.000000000', 'message': 'Tests the API in XML mode.

This form of testing has been nearly available for awhile but was not
turned on because it will increase the time of a full tox test run by
eight seconds. However there has recently been new features which do
not work at all with XML, so the time loss seems like a silly reason
to not gate on this.

implements blueprint test-with-xml

Change-Id: I98d892bb5c1a0c16425f80a28a296c70120318c8
'}]
commit_message:
Tests the API in XML mode.

This form of testing has been nearly available for awhile but was not
turned on because it will increase the time of a full tox test run by
eight seconds. However there has recently been new features which do
not work at all with XML, so the time loss seems like a silly reason
to not gate on this.

implements blueprint test-with-xml

Change-Id: I98d892bb5c1a0c16425f80a28a296c70120318c8

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-07 21:39:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix access_ip_* race

The code currently sets access_ip_* in a 2nd DB call after an instance
goes ACTIVE, which means there's a slight race when someone is querying the API for their instance.  It's possible to see the instance ACTIVE but
access_ip_* will be blank.

To fix this, we should set access_ip_* at the same time the instance goes
ACTIVE.  This also removes an unnecessary extra DB call.

Fixes bug 1152328

Change-Id: I0fe542d49fbc95f27a24f57f674264f8789bc527
"}, {'created': '2013-03-07 21:49:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix access_ip_* race

The code currently sets access_ip_* in a 2nd DB call after an instance
goes ACTIVE, which means there's a slight race when someone is querying
the API for their instance.  It's possible to see the instance ACTIVE but
access_ip_* will be blank.

To fix this, we should set access_ip_* at the same time the instance goes
ACTIVE.  This also removes an unnecessary extra DB call.

Fixes bug 1152328

Change-Id: I0fe542d49fbc95f27a24f57f674264f8789bc527
"}]
commit_message:
Fix access_ip_* race

The code currently sets access_ip_* in a 2nd DB call after an instance
goes ACTIVE, which means there's a slight race when someone is querying
the API for their instance.  It's possible to see the instance ACTIVE but
access_ip_* will be blank.

To fix this, we should set access_ip_* at the same time the instance goes
ACTIVE.  This also removes an unnecessary extra DB call.

Fixes bug 1152328

Change-Id: I0fe542d49fbc95f27a24f57f674264f8789bc527

@gordon: to answer your question above, I think the appropriate 2xx response for a PUT on v3 depends, slightly.

If a relationship did not already exist, a 201 should be returned.

If a relationship already existed and a sql.Conflict was caught, for example, the PUT should return a 200 (i.e. multiple identical PUTs should be idempotent, but the subsequent response codes should differ). So a for-loop of the same PUT over and over would return:

  201 -> 200 -> 200 -> 200 -> ...'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-03-07 16:00:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

^ I completely take that back. 204 is correct for all PUT's in v3 AFAIK."}, {'account_id': 6537, 'date': '2013-03-07 16:07:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@Dolph, thanks for the clarification. i'll change code to have just v3 POST return 201 Created. v3 PUT will remain 204 to match v3 API doc"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-03-07 16:09:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

return 201 Created on POST request (bug1131119)

correct status code from 200 Ok to 201 Created for v3 POST requests.

Fixes: bug #1131119

commit_message:
Add 'is' operator to extra specs ops.

Boolean values for capabilities don't work because extra_specs are
all converted to unicode. The scheduler will then check, for example,
if the boolean 'True' is equal to the unicode string 'True', and will
always return False. This patch allows admins to specify '<is> True'
in extra_specs, which will compare successfully to boolean True.

Fixes bug: 1146306

Change-Id: Id0e6dcfb71eb0943a16bba551ec23c4d57206550

commit_message:
simplify the chexor function

Replace all that map(operator) nonsense.

It changes the error raised on invalid hashes, but we don't handle that
anywhere, and it shouldn't ever happen in real life.

Change-Id: Ib8cb549fac05e0b2725b4ea295326ac0c5e1f035

commit_message:
heat common : BaseClient respect host argument

Currently the BaseClient class ignores any host argument and overwrites
it with the host from the keystone catalog URL, we should respect the
host parameter if it is passed, but make it optional

ref bug 1102101

Change-Id: I371e3b70a7bd207a177625c3e6855d8504678f1b

error if the user tries to use it.

ref bug 1102101

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-07 11:02:07.000000000', 'message': "cfn-push-stats : Add --haproxy-latency option

The --haproxy options sends a variety of metrics to the engine,
which can only accept one metric per watchrule, so will discard
all except the one specified on the CloudWatch alarm, so add a
version which only sends the Latency metric (since that's what
we care about for the internal loadbalancer resource)

ref bug 1133510

Change-Id: I53084dcbf14c28028af6cba0b8125663fefc6483
"}]
commit_message:
cfn-push-stats : Add --haproxy-latency option

The --haproxy options sends a variety of metrics to the engine,
which can only accept one metric per watchrule, so will discard
all except the one specified on the CloudWatch alarm, so add a
version which only sends the Latency metric (since that's what
we care about for the internal loadbalancer resource)

ref bug 1133510

Change-Id: I53084dcbf14c28028af6cba0b8125663fefc6483

commit_message:
Add image members tests.

This commit adds client methods for the glance v1 api for
interacting with image members. It also adds some basic tests
for creating, getting, and deleting image members.

Partially implements bp add-glance-api-v1-tests

Change-Id: I997ab525c05ed15bfd857b2cfb634379d0b3fec2

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-07 11:18:45.000000000', 'message': 'heat common : quieten policy logging

Policy logs the currently loaded policy for every request, which is
too noisy even for debug - we already log the file which contains
the policy when we load it, so this is probably sufficient.

commit_message:
heat common : quieten policy logging

Policy logs the currently loaded policy for every request, which is
too noisy even for debug - we already log the file which contains
the policy when we load it, so this is probably sufficient.

fixes bug 1150091

Change-Id: I0891a30793375c7a0a6b2856db4377eecfeaad8e

commit_message:
heat common : policy.py change LOG to logger

The convention in most other files is to use "logger" for the
log handle, so this file using "LOG" looks a bit odd/inconsistent

ref bug 1150091

Change-Id: I159ad59dfaa3a1db36aad11cb6ce9625f1105c51

commit_message:
Convenience method to look up resource by FnGetRefId

This assumes that no resource will raise an error when FnGetRefId is
called, and any resource that does really needs to be fixed.

Change-Id: I5b58a28661e4eb10ccb21e8b50ec131937618d4a

commit_message:
Add Domain subtree to keystone LDAP structure

Fixes Bug1144927
This fix adds a Domain subtree to the initial
LDAP structure for configuring keystone's LDAP.

Change-Id: I6ec06efc9e0a40bfc81d838b9f0d6167e9441dff

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 261, 'name': 'Salvatore Orlando', 'email': 'salv.orlando@gmail.com', 'username': 'salvatore-orlando'}, {'_account_id': 333, 'name': 'Isaku Yamahata', 'email': 'isaku.yamahata@gmail.com', 'username': 'yamahata'}, {'_account_id': 447, 'name': 'dan wendlandt', 'email': 'dan@nicira.com', 'username': 'danwent'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 1689, 'name': 'Robert Kukura', 'email': 'rk@theep.net', 'username': 'rkukura'}, {'_account_id': 2031, 'name': 'Nachi Ueno', 'email': 'nati.ueno@gmail.com', 'username': 'nati-ueno'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2583, 'name': 'Ante Karamati', 'email': 'ante.karamatic@canonical.com', 'username': 'ivoks'}, {'_account_id': 2592, 'name': 'Mark McClain', 'email': 'mark@mcclain.xyz', 'username': 'markmcclain'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6878, 'name': 'Floris', 'username': 'fsluiter'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 2031, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Code looks good..

At first glance, my comment was "could you write unit test for this?"
But it looks sqlalchemy didn't support this...

The Second thought was this kind of problem may occur another objects using relations. We should check it.'}, {'account_id': 2583, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/21424/3/check/gate-quantum-docs/3742 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21424/3/check/gate-quantum-pep8/4361 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21424/3/check/gate-quantum-python26/4130 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21424/3/check/gate-quantum-python27/4130 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21424/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/5671 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Need a short first commit line separated from everything else by a blank line.

DIMS querying IPAllocations only needs these changes if we are updating the table (i.e., allocating an IP).  At a glance, neither of the two places you point out seems to be allocating IPs.'}, {'account_id': 2583, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:45:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I looked at how SQL is being tested and, correct me if I'm wrong, test only covers sqlite. Sqlite doesn't expose this bug (no parallelization in sqlite). MySQL for some reason also doesn't expose this bug, while it should - maybe we just didn't try hard enough. PostgreSQL does expose it because it supports parallel row updates.

Even if we would be testing postgresql, as with any race condition bug, there are no guarantees behavior will be reproduced within one attempt.

I was surprised 'FOR UPDATE' lock wasn't used from the
start. I still don't have clear view of how SQL is handled within quantum (I've started working on it this week), but this was an obvious one. I would suggest merging this one and then fix other as they show up."}, {'account_id': 2583, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/21424/4/check/gate-quantum-pep8/4510 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21424/4/check/gate-quantum-docs/3891 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21424/4/check/gate-quantum-python26/4277 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21424/4/check/gate-quantum-python27/4279 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/21424/4/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/6683 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Are the -1s on this patch still valid - or can we consider them obsolete?'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I suspect not only db locking, but also other races.
- error recovery path
  Some plugins start another db transaction.
- rpc/notifycation order

They should be addressed/tracked as different bug, though.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I created BP to track race-issues I listed above.
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/quantum/+spec/fix-races-of-db-based-plugin'}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:45:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I'm not sure this is an issue as I'm not very familiar with with_lockmode, but I have one questionline inline."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2013-03-07 20:45:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Lock tables for update on allocation/deletion

Allocating, creating and deleting port might happen
in parallel and we need to make sure we don't
assign same IP to multiple different requests.

Added treatment for vlan tags and tunnel ID's

Fixes: bug #1110807

Change-Id: Idbb04d3ce6eacd308b05536f1942a35a0792199e

[{'created': '2013-03-05 16:57:57.000000000', 'message': 'Add apt dependencies for ceilometer tests

The ceilometer tests use an in-memory version of
MongoDB that uses spidermonkey for JavaScript
interpretation. spidermonkey, in turn, depends
on nspr and pkg-config.

Ceilometer also uses lxml, which wants libxml2-dev
and libxslt-dev.

Change-Id: Ie2fca1203107b6397fa6babbef37dbaae7592373
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}, {'created': '2013-03-05 16:58:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add apt dependencies for ceilometer tests

The ceilometer tests use an in-memory version of
MongoDB that uses spidermonkey for JavaScript
interpretation. spidermonkey, in turn, depends
on nspr and pkg-config.

Ceilometer also uses lxml, which wants libxml2-dev

commit_message:
Add apt dependencies for ceilometer tests

The ceilometer tests use an in-memory version of
MongoDB that uses spidermonkey for JavaScript
interpretation. spidermonkey, in turn, depends
on nspr and pkg-config.

Ceilometer also uses lxml, which wants libxml2-dev
and libxslt-dev.

bug 1115332

Change-Id: Ie2fca1203107b6397fa6babbef37dbaae7592373
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Use nose and openstack nose plugin.

It's a little silly since we're working on removing nose for testr,
but it turns out that the old test run wrapper was in use here, which was
causing all sorts of havoc.

Change-Id: Ib6e31547ec4921f91b6253a1798cb04ca6930c87

commit_message:
Fix nova boot --num-instances option checking

'args.num_instances' should be checked by None because of '0 == False'.
This patch fixes the checking.

Fixes bug 1151787

Change-Id: Iede860caa5c2d03d49471f375d687c3e40102372

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-05 18:03:00.000000000', 'message': 'Add missing action_start if deleting resized inst.

When trying to delete a resized instance Nova will automatically
call confirm on the resized instance to help clean things
up. With some of the recent action event changes in grizzly this
code path was broken due to a missing record_action_start
call on the confirm_resize operation.

Fixes LP Bug #1147387.

Change-Id: I23e84de8675c980656a71b71e34ffa0a0801f389
'}]
commit_message:
Add missing action_start if deleting resized inst.

When trying to delete a resized instance Nova will automatically
call confirm on the resized instance to help clean things
up. With some of the recent action event changes in grizzly this
code path was broken due to a missing record_action_start
call on the confirm_resize operation.

Fixes LP Bug #1147387.

Change-Id: I23e84de8675c980656a71b71e34ffa0a0801f389

This allows openstack services to be git/pip installed
without installing any startup scripts.

This is useful for keystone-db or nova-db elements, for
example, where the service must be installed to perform
database migration, but no service start scripts need
be installed.

Additionally, add a tool to create openstack sql databases.

commit_message:
Seperate install of services and start scripts:

This allows openstack services to be git/pip installed
without installing any startup scripts.

This is useful for keystone-db or nova-db elements, for
example, where the service must be installed to perform
database migration, but no service start scripts need
be installed.

Additionally, add a tool to create openstack sql databases.

Use openstack pypi mirror:

Use the openstack pypi mirror for openstack service
installation. It's much faster than pypi.org.

Also, pip install $svc_repo/tools/pip-requires first,
if it exists, which is required to pick up oslo.config.

Change-Id: I72751d4da59f8597d20aea2f27a9dfabe2f63a8f

Attempt at docs based on commit message and blueprint. Some things I was fuzzy on:

The blueprint page: http://wiki.openstack.org/blueprint-nova-compute-cells mentions running the same nova-manage command in the API cell and child cells. I didn't understand why this was necessary to do in the child cells, but document as-is anyways.

The nova-manage cell create commands has options woffset and wscale that aren't described, not sure what they do."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-01-07 19:11:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Cool.  I'll look through this.  Before this is approved, we should probably make sure this lands:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/15229/

That's the review that actually adds the nova-manage functionality."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-01-07 20:28:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Ok, a few things:

1) quota.NoopQuotaDriver hasn't landed yet.  This review needs to go back up.  There were some issues with the initial one.
2) nova-manage changes are hopefully landing soon
3) The reason for the nova-manage commands in parent cells and child cells is that the parent cell needs to be configured to know its children.  And the child cell needs to be configured to know its parent.  The 2 commands *are* different in your examples and seem to be correct.  The command for the parent cell adds the child cell.  The command for the child cell adds the parent cell.
4) woffset/wscale are not used by the main patch.  wscale might be removed, so it may be good to just leave it out.  When the cells scheduler weights/filtering patch lands, there's a weigher plugin that can use woffset to weight one cell higher than another for scheduling.

I think that's it."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2013-01-07 20:38:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Chris:

Re: #3, I was referring to this line that I copied verbatim from: 
http://wiki.openstack.org/blueprint-nova-compute-cells

"Repeat the above for all child cells."

That seems to suggest that the exact same nova-manage command run on the API cell should be run on the child cells, *in addition* to the command that just runs on the child cells.

Looking at that wiki page, I think the author might have made an error, and meant to instead write:

"Repeat the below for all child cells."'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2013-01-08 19:12:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Aha.  It's not very clear at all.  I removed that wording from the Wiki and expanded the example to show multiple cells."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2013-01-09 14:20:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23683/2/check/gate-glance-pep8/4001 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/23683/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/12446 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-03-06 18:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I wonder if the len() method should be added to the CooperativeReader object instead of having the test inspect its fd data member.  If the test expects this behavior of the object perhaps other future things would as well.'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-03-06 18:52:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Thanks! And sorry for the bug.

I think John's suggestion makes a lot of sense.

On the bug ticket, you looked at putting the call to CooperativeReader in the controller, IIRC. Can you comment on the change to putting in the storage domain layer?

Thanks again!"}, {'account_id': 6159, 'date': '2013-03-06 20:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-03-07 10:08:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Re: len() method

 So if you add this it breaks v1 upload to swift :-)

 I think swift inspects what methods are available
 and if it sees a len it makes certain assumptions.
 As far as I can tell CooperativeReader would need
 to have a len method that always works, but that's not possible
 since there's no guarantee that the underlying fd will have a
 working len method. If you start to look at dynamically
 adding a method to the class you can still run into problems
 since if swift inspects the class to see if the method exists
 rather than an instance of the class this can lead to unexpected
 behaviour. In short I didn't see a way to do this using a couple
 of lines (I tried 'setattr', various __len__ tricks and
 MethodType) -- if noone else can either it probably merits a
 separate commit.

Re: putting CooperativeReader in the storage domain layer

 I think I felt that this should be closer to the storage layer
 ie that anytime we're pushing data into the store (whether
 via the Controller or not) it should go through a CooperativeReader.
 Its a judgement call though -- I'm happy to put back in the Controller
 if you think that's best."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2013-03-07 16:58:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Functionally tested in devstack.'}, {'account_id': 455, 'date': '2013-03-07 17:06:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

FWIW I've asked for a test for this in tempest (https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1149928)"}, {'account_id': 6493, 'date': '2013-03-07 17:11:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 616, 'date': '2013-03-07 18:14:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Stuart:

I'd at least like to move the "Cooperative" part out of the domain--since the domain really shouldn't be specific to eventlet or any other framework. And I think in general the domain set_data method should have a very clear expectation of what "data" is (a file or an iterable, not both), and do as much as possible to hide the idiosyncrasies of swiftclient in glance/store/swift.py. But these are wish-list items for me, so lets get this great fix in.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-07 18:14:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.
http://status.openstack.org/zuul/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-07 18:51:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23683/2/gate/gate-glance-docs/2075 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/23683/2/gate/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/12721 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-07 18:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

[{'created': '2013-03-06 11:08:11.000000000', 'message': "Fix v2 data upload to swift

An upload of image data via the v2 api when using a swift backend would
stacktrace with 'UnsupportedOperation: seek'.

Wrap the data in a CooperativeReader to both 1) fix this issue and 2) reap
the multi-threaded 'sheduling fairness' benefit of the CooperativeReader.

Also add a 'len' method to CooperativeReader as this was needed by a
unit test.

Fix for bug 1147231.

Change-Id: I604c67d2d6ecd77a12e11b2f641edb4095c4bb60
"}, {'created': '2013-03-06 14:29:24.000000000', 'message': "Fix v2 data upload to swift

An upload of image data via the v2 api when using a swift backend would
stacktrace with 'UnsupportedOperation: seek'.

Wrap the data in a CooperativeReader to both 1) fix this issue and 2) reap
the multi-threaded 'sheduling fairness' benefit of the CooperativeReader.

Fix for bug 1147231.

Change-Id: I604c67d2d6ecd77a12e11b2f641edb4095c4bb60
"}]
commit_message:
Fix v2 data upload to swift

An upload of image data via the v2 api when using a swift backend would
stacktrace with 'UnsupportedOperation: seek'.

Wrap the data in a CooperativeReader to both 1) fix this issue and 2) reap
the multi-threaded 'sheduling fairness' benefit of the CooperativeReader.

Fix for bug 1147231.

Change-Id: I604c67d2d6ecd77a12e11b2f641edb4095c4bb60

commit_message:
NVP plugin: configure metadata network only if overlapping IPs are enabled

Bug 1152144

This patch also add a warning emitted in the logs at startup if the
configuration is not correct.

Change-Id: Idbf10c64f068a71ef1ed9c29a6a0c4e736bb975d

commit_message:
Ensure disk_ and container_format during upload

This patch changes the image domain model so that the transition from
'queued' to 'saving' or 'active' status cannot take place if the image's
disk_format or container_format are not set.

Fixes bug 1131994

Change-Id: I454d9df736edd771f9d5d93eca4cd317116cc985

Change-Id: I84b3acb2ed83dc2b1ff8f1a21ca1d95f7d25751a
"}, {'created': '2013-03-04 21:54:44.000000000', 'message': "Read baremetal images from extra_specs namespace.

Baremetal PXE driver should read deploy_kernel_id & deploy_ramdisk_id
from the 'baremetal:' namespace within instance_type['extra_specs']

commit_message:
Read baremetal images from extra_specs namespace.

Baremetal PXE driver should read deploy_kernel_id & deploy_ramdisk_id
from the 'baremetal:' namespace within instance_type['extra_specs']
so that it doesn't conflict with ComputeCapabilitiesFilter any more.

Fixes bug 1129485.

Change-Id: I84b3acb2ed83dc2b1ff8f1a21ca1d95f7d25751a

commit_message:
Wait in TestBinGlance.test_update_copying_from until image is active

Test randomly fails on slow machines, the updated image is still
in 'Status: saving' while 'Status: active' is expected. So loop around
the "glance show" command until the image leaves the 'saving' state
(bug 1107768).

Change-Id: I908069b35079dcc8ccd25acb3ebc74fe43f9d524

commit_message:
Clean dangling image fragments in filesystem store

Fixes bug LP 1104924

Previously when a PUT or POST of image content was terminated
prematurely by the client, the partially saved image file was
left behind in the data directory.

Change-Id: Id601816735e4138cd7623dad4d90be67448292c8

Thank you for clarifying the commit message.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-05 08:55:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I see what this is doing and it looks valid, but I don't see why you're doing it or where you're heading with it

I see e.g. Iad9d640b44df5f3831de58f9e800bcf42bc0610e where we copy this stuff into system_metadata but it now sounds like you want to remove instance_type field from instances?

Is that where this is going? A bit of verbiage on that in the commit messages or bug report would be good

Thanks"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-03-05 14:30:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This has been a long-running theme and goal for us. It should really have been a blueprint with lots of explanation, but it started as part of something else and vish wants to get this finished before grizzly.

The problem being that instance['instance_type'] is a backref to the instance_types table, which means we can never delete or change an instance_type without affecting instances that may still be running with those details. The goal of pushing the data into system_metadata (which is already done) decouples the instances from their actual instance type at boot time, leaving us with the type information they were started with tied to the instance, and not the actual flavor.

Further, this does potentially mean we could cut the cord to the instance_types table, at least from the joinedload perspective, which would reduce the number of unnecessary joins we're doing at instance lookup time.

I'll be glad to throw an explanation into the commit message, but it is one in a string of commits before and after this, so I didn't think it was necessary/desirable to replicate it each."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-05 14:34:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't think you have to duplicate that entire description in every commit, just shorten it to 1 or 2 lines. The full description should go in the linked bug report though, since we don't have a blueprint for this."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-03-05 14:48:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Okay, bug updated, will follow up here with some slightly heavier commit messages.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2013-03-05 15:56:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2013-03-05 15:57:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Remove uses of instance['instance_type'] from xenapi driver.

Note that this includes a fix to tests/db/fakes.py to make the fake
instance_type structures look like the database models.

This is one change in a series aimed at removing the use of instance-linked
instance_type objects, in favor of the decoupled type data in
system_metadata. See bug 1140119 for more details.

Change-Id: Ieb107fbaf0f3b5a42681aefc0ffdefdb8c0f98a5

Add the 2013.1b4 tarball to tools/pip-requires - this will be changed

commit_message:
Use oslo.config-1.1.0b1

The cfg API is now available via the oslo-config library, so switch to
it and remove the copied-and-pasted version.

Add the oslo.config-1.1.0b1 tarball to tools/pip-requires - this will
be changed to 'oslo-config>=2013.1' when oslo-config is published to
pypi. This will happen in time for grizzly final.

Remove the 'deps = pep8==1.3.3' from tox.ini as it means all the other
deps get installed with easy_install which can't install oslo-config
from the URL.

Change-Id: Ie803935d5f1b4fb88e76932cc42ce22b45acffad

commit_message:
Added hacking file

As part of adding the hacking file, this patch adds some files taken
from nova project that will help with the coding standards validation.

Tox now uses run_pep8 for the pep8 test

Change-Id: I0784390a0b13c9694e358563d43e5442592a785e

commit_message:
Remove duplicate API logging.

Before each API call logged the same data three times on INFO level. We only need to log the information once.

Fix bug 975589

Change-Id: I24131cf9f1c27030ecc99e638e9f4126096a0b96

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-05 12:47:20.000000000', 'message': 'Remove trailing slash from ceilometer endpoint URLs

Fixes bug 1146794

Ensure the URLs configured for the ceilometer endpoint in the keystone
service catalog do not contain a trailing forward slash.

Otherwise, this leads to an extra forward slash in the URL paths
constructed by the ceilometer client, which in turn is problematic
for the v2 API.

Change-Id: I7d457efc6e01e4e955388f52a4907524052f0173
'}]
commit_message:
Remove trailing slash from ceilometer endpoint URLs

Fixes bug 1146794

Ensure the URLs configured for the ceilometer endpoint in the keystone
service catalog do not contain a trailing forward slash.

Otherwise, this leads to an extra forward slash in the URL paths
constructed by the ceilometer client, which in turn is problematic
for the v2 API.

Change-Id: I7d457efc6e01e4e955388f52a4907524052f0173

commit_message:
Fix oslo.config and unittest.

Switch to the new oslo.config package which was renamed from
oslo-config.

Use python-keystoneclient master version as a temporary workaround for
bug #1151665.

Temporary workdaround of the bug #1151345 by comment out the test code
to pass the jenkin's gate test.

Change-Id: I7c223f3e98c5d33993b345d93c27f97d3d926d80

commit_message:
an empty list of args should be counted as None

Things break otherwise because of "is not None" checks in other
methods of the class

Fixes bug 1143998

Change-Id: Id9cd4593bc633097ae7d33116a7f87975c353075

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-07 15:52:30.000000000', 'message': "Don't check exit codes when patching.

Similar to what we did in 427769c we need to ignore checking
exit codes for patch -N command so that they can be run multiple
times.

The motivation here is that I would like to use this to patch
virtual env's created by tox. Tox doesn't provide a good hook
to call post_process (which patches files) only once so the
idea here is we'll just let it call post_process all the time...

Change-Id: I866e7a3e1fd492d7d4c08eb55cde02f2dfa16c9a
"}]
commit_message:
Don't check exit codes when patching.

Similar to what we did in 427769c we need to ignore checking
exit codes for patch -N command so that they can be run multiple
times.

The motivation here is that I would like to use this to patch
virtual env's created by tox. Tox doesn't provide a good hook
to call post_process (which patches files) only once so the
idea here is we'll just let it call post_process all the time...

Change-Id: I866e7a3e1fd492d7d4c08eb55cde02f2dfa16c9a

commit_message:
Improve unit tests for wsgi module

OpenStack quantum.wsgi package includes a lot of components not covered with unit tests.

Add unittests for the following classes:
* Serializer
* RequestDeserializer
* ResponseSerializer
* Request
* ActionDispatcher
* ResponseHeadersSerializer
* DictSerializer
* XMLDictSerializer
* JSONDictSerializer
* TextDeserializer
* JSONDeserializer
* XMLDeserializer
* RequestHeadersDeserializer
* Resource
* Fault

Change-Id: I76ae915f558bb8ab86ada314fbe866a2756feb31
Fixes: bug #1136027

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-07 01:35:34.000000000', 'message': "Update install_venv_common to use patch -N.

This patch makes it possible to call the post_process function
in install_venv_common (which currently only patches files)
multiple times.

The motivation here is that I would like to use this to patch
virtual env's created by tox. Tox doesn't provide a good hook
to call post_process (which patches files) only once so the
idea here is we'll just let it call post_process all the time...
and for distro's where patching is used to fix the venv the
patch -N option will make it skip patches on subsequent runs.

Change-Id: Ib0a36e49dd1884de131c569fe8bb66fe20285e97
"}]
commit_message:
Update install_venv_common to use patch -N.

This patch makes it possible to call the post_process function
in install_venv_common (which currently only patches files)
multiple times.

The motivation here is that I would like to use this to patch
virtual env's created by tox. Tox doesn't provide a good hook
to call post_process (which patches files) only once so the
idea here is we'll just let it call post_process all the time...
and for distro's where patching is used to fix the venv the
patch -N option will make it skip patches on subsequent runs.

Change-Id: Ib0a36e49dd1884de131c569fe8bb66fe20285e97

(Also, paste.openstack.org doesn't support having multiple files in one paste, hence the gist.)"}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2013-03-06 21:05:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Given the test.conf file looks ok (and all other config is ok) the results you get can come from:
1. A different tests.conf file is being used - in case you have set a 'SWIFT_TEST_CONFIG_FILE' env
2. Running the test from a different branch (not the patched one)

Please retry.








tested this again on my system - the exact behavior that you saw happens if you are not using the parameters in test.conf. 

A very similar behaviour (but slighly different) happens when you are using the master branch instead of a patched one. 



using a non patched version of the code (or that you fail to add the required configuration to the test.conf file that is being used). commit_message:
heat engine : allow Properties validation failure events

Currently if properties.validate() fails causing the resource
to go to CREATE_FAILED state, we get an error when creating
the event, because the bad properties are evaluated in the event
constructor.  Instead create a dummy Error property with the
error string for the event.

ref bug 1146529

Change-Id: I12f11de617d796d65c67a5ddb6d74c86adf67b5d

commit_message:
heat tests : move GenericResource into tests directory

The resource.py GenericResource type is only used in tests, so
move it into the tests area, such that it can't accidentally be
used in the main heat codebase when we fail to import any resource
plugins..

Change-Id: I3912cc540903002a6dd5109e7ce51c7eb67ebf10

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-07 09:34:13.000000000', 'message': "isolated network metadata does not work with nvp plugin

This patch removes the not self.conf.enable_metadata_network
check before adding METADATA_DEFAULT_IP to ip_cidrs. This result
of this is that the dhcp agent interface will have
169.254.169.254/16 on it even if the network is
enable_metadata_network=True which doesn't matter and happens anyway if one
sets enable_meta_network=False. This change only effects the nvp plugin
as this is the only one that uses the enable_metadata_network flag.

Change-Id: Ifb3b28daed9e3bfc61bb0d8a48c40d027d0e2a51
"}]
commit_message:
isolated network metadata does not work with nvp plugin

This patch removes the not self.conf.enable_metadata_network
check before adding METADATA_DEFAULT_IP to ip_cidrs. This result
of this is that the dhcp agent interface will have
169.254.169.254/16 on it even if the network is
enable_metadata_network=True which doesn't matter and happens anyway if one
sets enable_meta_network=False. This change only effects the nvp plugin
as this is the only one that uses the enable_metadata_network flag.

Change-Id: Ifb3b28daed9e3bfc61bb0d8a48c40d027d0e2a51

(4 inline comments)

I agree it would be nice for an admin to know these values without grepping the config file. This change kind of 'simulates' a driver by always returning the configuration flags regardless of the tenant. This is why probably we should have a driver for that rather than an extension whose controller changes according to quantum configuration. 

Although the diff is small, this is more a 'feature' than a 'bug'. Probably we're too late in the release cycle for 'nice to have' things.

Ps: you probably need unit tests, unless _get_quotas is already covered by existing ones."}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2013-03-07 09:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

sorry, I forgot to add some comments on the commit message.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-03-07 09:29:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

It is a nice feature though I am not sure it should be accepted for Grizzly or not. I think it is worth considering moving quota extension to core API. In addition Horizon shows quota information and it would be nice if quantum always provides the quota information.

Regarding the implementation proposed in this patch, I feel the same impression as Salvatore's comments. This feature is better to be implemented as a driver and QuotaController can be common for both modes (per-tenant and config mode)."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-03-07 09:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-03-07 09:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (9 inline comments)

Code looks good.
Just a few minor comments inline.

As a general comment, it's a shame we need to add so much boilerplate code for unit tests. For this particular case, we could probably think about refactoring the unit tests for both quota controllers using a common base class.

The real improvement would be being able to test exclusively the quota extension without having to load the whole infrastructure as we do now. But this is another story.

Finally, I know you've pretty much copied over the code from the pre-existing test case, but mtaylor adviced us against using tearDown; this could be replaced by adding a cleanup hook, which has the great advantage of being executed even if the test fails during setUp."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2013-03-07 09:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: (3 inline comments)

commit_message:
Show default configuration Quotas

Fixes bug 1144076

The patch set shows the defualt quotas that exist in
the configuration file. This is if the DB_QUOTA_DRIVER
is not configured. In this case the user is required
to update the configuration file and restart the service.

Change-Id: I5517c0215e8cfa71453ee38c34d8249e74346fdf

commit_message:
Fix Storwize/SVC storage_protocol reporting.

The Storwize/SVC driver supports both FC and iSCSI protocols
simultaneously. Therefore, 'storage_protocol' should be defined as a
list of enabled protocols, not simply 'iSCSI'. The extra_specs
key-value would then be, for example, storage_protocol='<in> iSCSI'
or storage_protocol='<in> FC'.

Fixes bug: 1142196

Change-Id: Ib99a6d4e4e61d07ddb4f173c13fe7e9f5482fa2b

?an you explain, please, a little bit clearer what do you mean while mentioning swift3?
Should we make some additional actions to be a part of tree / new Swift release?

Thank you."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-02-27 00:53:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Almost there.

I think you just need to unquote the account like you do with the container and object. Check out this test case:

    $ curl "http://192.168.22.2:8080/endpoints/ac%20count/con%20tainer/ob%20ject" && echo
    ["http://127.0.0.1:6030/sdb3/4196/ac%2520count/con%20tainer/ob%20ject", "http://127.0.0.1:6010/sdb1/4196/ac%2520count/con%20tainer/ob%20ject", "http://127.0.0.1:6040/sdb4/4196/ac%2520count/con%20tainer/ob%20ject"]

You can see that the account name is double-URL-escaped, while the container and object are (correctly) single-URL-escaped.

Other than that, it does what it claims to do.'}, {'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-02-27 12:14:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-02-27 12:17:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-27 12:25:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Doesn't seem to work

Seems like the Jenkins error isn't related to my code, so, I'll send "recheck" one more time.'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-02-27 15:22:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Despite my earlier +2, I think Pete raises a good point.  I'd like to more broadly discuss the question, "do we want this in the tree, and if we do, why do we keep swift3 out?" before approving.

@Sergey: there's a somewhat subjective difference between middleware modules which are appropriate for inclusion in "core swift" (this git repo) like tempauth, formpost, etc. and those which are more appropriately hosted as separate projects (e.g. on GitHub like https://github.com/gholt/swauth or https://github.com/cschwede/swquota).

We think it's important to not have every possible middleware in the main repo, while at the same time "shipping" Swift with a set of middleware generally applicable and likely to be used by some decent fraction of the deployers.

I just want to talk a bit about which category this middleware falls into.

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-02-27 21:53:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck bug 1091028'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-02-27 21:54:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-02-28 04:23:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Darrell, Samuel, thank you.

Data locality is a very important specialty for tons of software such as distributed computing frameworks, etc.

I think that it'll be great to have this feature out of the box. It implements the ability to list endpoints for an object, account or container, to make it possible to integrate swift with software that relies on data locality information to avoid network overhead. There are no restrictions on the application that will use this opportunity. For example, there is a patch to Hadoop (popular MapReduce framework) on the go that provides an ability to use Swift as the FileSystem. It means that we can run our jobs (in terms of Hadoop) on Swift nodes without network overhead.

Additionally, it's a very small patch well covered by tests that will bring good-sounding feature "Support for software that relies on data locality" to Swift.

So, it's my point of having this middleware in the main repo of Swift.

Thank you.'}, {'account_id': 6786, 'date': '2013-03-04 19:28:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Are there any comments?'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-04 21:30:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Support listing endpoints for an object.

Implements blueprint list-endpoints.

DocImpact: new middleware list_endpoints.

Change-Id: I0c4911ff726abd4cb8ce2b6245c99786ad46b410

commit_message:
Fix 3PAR drivers to work in multi-backend mode.

The 3PAR drivers weren't updated when the multi backend
patch landed on G3 day.  This patch implements the new config
mechanism to accessing FLAGS, so that it works when an admin
has multiple drivers active.

This fixes
bug 1131346

Change-Id: Icc5475d15bfd0fa14aae12ab8a8370a894e46857

>>> import imp

>>> 

What does this do on OSX ?'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-02-19 19:23:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

on OS X: 

 dhcp-104:~ jogo$ python
 Python 2.7.1 (r271:86832, Jun 16 2011, 16:59:05) 
 [GCC 4.2.1 (Based on Apple Inc. build 5658) (LLVM build 2335.15.00)] on darwin
 Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
 >>> import boto
 >>> import boto.ec2
 >>> ^D
 dhcp-104:~ jogo$ python
 Python 2.7.1 (r271:86832, Jun 16 2011, 16:59:05) 
 [GCC 4.2.1 (Based on Apple Inc. build 5658) (LLVM build 2335.15.00)] on  darwin
 Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
 >>> import imp
 >>> imp.find_module('boto.ec2')
 Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
 ImportError: No module named boto.ec2

 Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
 ImportError: No module named boto/ec2
 >>> ^D'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-20 14:46:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This does not seams as the documented behavior.

Can you show me an example when it finds something nested on OSX ? Can you tell me why it behaves differently ?

The nova fixed the 'not working' issue, but on Linux it does inspection equivalent operation in all cases.

AFAIK tempest only claims, Linux support. Finding a solution which workarounds OSX behavior, is not as critical, than We had to choose different solutions becuse of the unintended code execution."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-02-20 18:28:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

there has been another patch to hacking.py in nova ... try  the latest.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2013-02-22 12:22:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

yeh, we just need to pick up the latest. I'm going to work to get this stuff into oslo soon so we don't keep cross importing."}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-22 14:27:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I will -2 all hacking.py module import code modification, which does not solves the code execution issue.'}, {'account_id': 5803, 'date': '2013-02-22 15:07:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Config file /etc/tempest/tempest.conf not found
19 imports missing in this test environment
Gate test Failed


Jenkins does not likes that version.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2013-02-27 18:05:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Filed and fixed the bug you described. https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1134622'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-07 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Server Instance Count for Nova Flavors

Prevents deletion of flavors with instances based on it
and add instance count when listing flavors.
Blueprint: server-count-for-nova-flavors
Change-Id: Iac3e755131a8880b1b508b169ecf7c889eb8f29b

commit_message:
Fixed code for second attempt of signing

Previously by mistake we were splitting signature instead of host
during attempt to sign in without port.

Test added.

Change-Id: I320fe8ca303ed0d32090e0d9f99b63d20762ccca
Fixes: bug #1040696

commit_message:
Fixes data type bug in get-user call

Additionally, fixes a bug in the fake guestagent causing
grant permissions to persist after a user is deleted.

Partially addresses bug #1132975

Change-Id: I2b6951d1569224661747b3a889c8840ce2b205fa

It's good to keep cinder.conf update-to-date but my concern is it doesn't make sense for each vendor update sample configuration file on their own once in while.  A better practice may be we update this configuration every one/two/three or even 6 months?"}, {'account_id': 6094, 'date': '2013-03-07 05:19:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

There are common options in iscsi and nfs drivers.'}, {'account_id': 4355, 'date': '2013-03-07 05:26:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Navneet,
The sample cinder.conf file is automatically generated from the code using a script.  There is no need to update specific options manually.  As long as your options are correct in the code they will be correctly added to the sample conf file.  Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 6094, 'date': '2013-03-07 05:28:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Huang, Avishay, Oliver would not like vendors to update it. So leaving it to be updated by them. Withdrawing the changes.'}]

Hey Tim,

Thanks for reviewing.  Can you tell me what functionality you are expecting to  see.  I'll happily add what's missing.  In my tests I'm able to do the following.

$ reddwarf-cli limit
(returns help with cmds available)

$ reddwarf-cli limit list
(returns json)

$ reddwarf-cli limit list --verbose --debug
(returns json with curl cmd + debugging)

-Dan"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-07 05:19:22.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-07 05:19:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

commit_message:
Add glance api v2 testing.

This commit adds initial support for the glance v2 api. It adds
some basic image tests and a new v2 client. The client supports
create, get metadata, store, get image, and delete.

Change-Id: Ic8c79356d4dcadc35bb3a7aa0deac2336e370827

[{'created': '2013-03-07 00:47:09.000000000', 'message': "Remove unnecessary setUp() and tearDown() methods

It's unnecessary to implement setUp() and tearDown() when they only call
the parent class method of the same name.

Change-Id: I8a2c7f50e17def87ada8d4f1c1b554eb916afbd1
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary setUp() and tearDown() methods

It's unnecessary to implement setUp() and tearDown() when they only call
the parent class method of the same name.

Change-Id: I8a2c7f50e17def87ada8d4f1c1b554eb916afbd1

Add tox, pep8, pyflakes, testr support

change otherwise we'll never bootstrap gating.

Add get_volume_stats in the sheepdog driver.

1. Allow sheepdog driver to report capabilities to the scheduler.
2. add the initial test_sheepdog.py

Fixes Bug #1140162

Change-Id: I6fb1fb6714ab4ae9878b593e6eee0a94d95ef29f

Remove redundant requirements from test-requires.

from tools/test-requires.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-06 02:50:02.000000000', 'message': 'Allow instance NetworkInterfaces to be list of str or dict

It should be possible to specify NetworkInterfaces of an instance either
as an array of strings or as an array of dicts.

The following should now be possible:
This will define nics in the order specified by DeviceIndex
"NetworkInterfaces" : [
  { "NetworkInterfaceId" : {"Ref" : "controlXface"}, "DeviceIndex" : "0" },
  { "NetworkInterfaceId" : {"Ref" : "controlXface2"}, "DeviceIndex" : "1" },
],

This will define nics in the order specified by list position
"NetworkInterfaces" : [{"Ref" : "controlXface"}, {"Ref" : "controlXface2"}],

Mixing the 2 forms is supported but the resulting order is not defined.

Amazon documentation is ambigious about which form is actually supported
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-properties-ec2-instance.html#cfn-ec2-instance-networkinterfaces
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/quickref-ec2.html#cfn-template-snippets-eni
Fixes: Bug #1096013

Change-Id: Id387d2e750cbe533a9b8a1fedc49d5bcf690fbcf
'}]
commit_message:
Allow instance NetworkInterfaces to be list of str or dict

It should be possible to specify NetworkInterfaces of an instance either
as an array of strings or as an array of dicts.

The following should now be possible:
This will define nics in the order specified by DeviceIndex
"NetworkInterfaces" : [
  { "NetworkInterfaceId" : {"Ref" : "controlXface"}, "DeviceIndex" : "0" },
  { "NetworkInterfaceId" : {"Ref" : "controlXface2"}, "DeviceIndex" : "1" },
],

This will define nics in the order specified by list position
"NetworkInterfaces" : [{"Ref" : "controlXface"}, {"Ref" : "controlXface2"}],

Mixing the 2 forms is supported but the resulting order is not defined.

Amazon documentation is ambigious about which form is actually supported
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/aws-properties-ec2-instance.html#cfn-ec2-instance-networkinterfaces
http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSCloudFormation/latest/UserGuide/quickref-ec2.html#cfn-template-snippets-eni
Fixes: Bug #1096013

Change-Id: Id387d2e750cbe533a9b8a1fedc49d5bcf690fbcf
