Although I see your use case here, I can not agree in patching bundled code. 

If someone else updates jquery-ui to a newer version, this will break again. I see two options:
- fix jquery-ui upstream
- fix the compressor (which might also fix other occurrences of the same error)."}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2013-03-04 16:22:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I totally agree this is a band-aid type fix.  The issue I encountered is this bug make Horizon unusable when installing from debian packages on precise.  I also agree that fixing the compression engine is a better solution.  I just wanted horizon to remain usable in the interim.  Is there a better way to post this type of fix?'}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2013-03-04 16:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Another option would be to move jquery-ui-1.9.2.custom.min.js outside of the {% compress %} tag in _scripts.html'}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2013-03-04 17:59:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

root cause has been updated in the comments of the bug: https://code.launchpad.net/bugs/1130610'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-03-04 20:36:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Has someone filed/found an upstream bug on this with the jQuery folks. I'd like to see if this could be/has been identified upstream. That looks like a really unnecessary way for them to write that bit of code and could see many minifiers choking on it."}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2013-03-04 21:20:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Bugs have been filed and closed, as recently as 2/22/2013.  Was fixed back in 1.8.2 but broke again in 1.9 time-frame.  Other minifiers break on it as well.  But truly the fault lies in the minifier.  And indeed the newer version of python-django-compressor-1.2 handles this syntax.'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-03-05 19:19:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Do not merge

The version of Compressor isn't pinned in the pip-requires file, and I know see that the bug does say this is strictly a problem with the debian packages.

Now that I fully understand the issue, I'm actually going to say that this is a bug which should be addressed in the ubuntu horizon package, not in trunk. The patch you suggested here could easily be applied there, or the debian package for compressor could (and should) be updated.

I'll update the bug appropriately."}, {'account_id': 5623, 'date': '2013-03-07 00:11:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Bug fix is to debian packaging not horizon code.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-01 17:27:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing javascript SyntaxError due to js compression

javascript library jquery-ui-1.9.2.custom.min.js contains a line
containing '(this.id="ui-id-"+ ++n)' that when compressed becomes
'(this.id="ui-id-"+++n)' which causes a syntax error.

I changed the line to read '(this.id="ui-id-"+ (++n))' which
compresses to '(this.id="ui-id-"+(++n))'

This compression error does not reproduce when running in the
virtual environment, but does when installing from debian packages.

Fixes: bug #1130610
Change-Id: If7de89685467676a16441157ec1205a3da116233
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing javascript SyntaxError due to js compression

javascript library jquery-ui-1.9.2.custom.min.js contains a line
containing '(this.id="ui-id-"+ ++n)' that when compressed becomes
'(this.id="ui-id-"+++n)' which causes a syntax error.

I changed the line to read '(this.id="ui-id-"+ (++n))' which
compresses to '(this.id="ui-id-"+(++n))'

This compression error does not reproduce when running in the
virtual environment, but does when installing from debian packages.

Fixes: bug #1130610
Change-Id: If7de89685467676a16441157ec1205a3da116233

commit_message:
Allow REST stack lookup by ARN

This uses the same approach as the cfn api, which assumes the stack
name is an arn, before falling back to an identify_stack call.

Change-Id: I64e9826fa58e05863e9459d3aab041a8d7997405
Fixes: Bug #1131759

But Kernel depends on things outside marconi.common, which
results in a recursive dependency if they import anything under
marconi.common.

Change-Id: Ibfeb5abe9fc21a8bcf170d1eddceac44e5abf844

commit_message:
Move marconi.common.Kernel to marconi.Kernel.

marconi.common should contain commonly importable utilities.
But Kernel depends on things outside marconi.common, which
results in a recursive dependency if they import anything under
marconi.common.

Change-Id: Ibfeb5abe9fc21a8bcf170d1eddceac44e5abf844

commit_message:
Use tarball for python-reddwarfclient dependency

* Openstack-ci creates a tarball at tarballs.o.o when tag matches:
  ref: ^refs/tags/([0-9]+\.)+[0-9]*
        (alpha|beta|candidate|rc|a|b|c|r|g)[0-9]*$

Fixes bug#1131509

Change-Id: I5e3d00c57dfe977f6e9a01dea25b97c8fcdf0d1d

commit_message:
Improve style of network topology

fixes bug 1129190
- display a message when there is no router, network or instance to show
- remove link from not owned network
- improve layout algorithm
- improve css to change router icon
- fix auto update layout

Change-Id: Ibbbf55a53939ab1446f3cb36165a5cf45c27c28c

commit_message:
Implements blueprint quantum-lbaas-plugin-support

Add support for quantum lbaas plugin.
Configure service_plugins and lbaas agent
in case q-lbaas service is enabled in localrc

Change-Id: Iebaa1ed6a7209175504230faf802a94dc841392f

commit_message:
Fixes data type bug in get-user call

Also fixes an authentication problem preventing rd-client calls
from finding their service endpoint and issuing calls.

Partially addresses bug #1132975

Change-Id: Iae2badda67793f30d957e414ee87d32853ef3d8e

commit_message:
make parsed template snapshots before updating

This is to make sure that as the update progresses and dependant
resources are modified/replaced that we compare the original
dynamic data with the current.

bug 1134258
Change-Id: Ia4e474e914aa9e99e5e569c4f2276beb55798421

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-01-28 19:14:12.000000000', 'message': 'Remove security group handler info from doc

Since we are not upstreaming the nova security group handler that proxies
security group calls from nova to quantum this part of the doc should be
removed. The nova security group proxy which proxies security group commands
directly to quantum without having to go through the nova database will
replace the functionality.

Fixes bug 1088304

Change-Id: If95bc2c6a656ed4bd1bf64f2f799c379f6ee4bca
'}, {'created': '2013-02-28 18:25:26.000000000', 'message': 'Update quantum security group information

This patch updates the security group information with the new nova
integration bits and removes the references to proxy_mode and external_id
since this was removed from quantum.

Fixes bug 1088304

Change-Id: If95bc2c6a656ed4bd1bf64f2f799c379f6ee4bca
'}, {'created': '2013-02-28 18:26:22.000000000', 'message': 'Update quantum security group information

This patch updates the security group information with the new nova
integration bits and removes the references to proxy_mode and external_id
since this was removed from quantum.

Fixes bug 1088304

Change-Id: If95bc2c6a656ed4bd1bf64f2f799c379f6ee4bca
'}]
commit_message:
Update quantum security group information

This patch updates the security group information with the new nova
integration bits and removes the references to proxy_mode and external_id
since this was removed from quantum.

Fixes bug 1088304

Change-Id: If95bc2c6a656ed4bd1bf64f2f799c379f6ee4bca

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-06 17:32:02.000000000', 'message': "heat engine : watchrule quietly discard unused metric data

Some cfn-push-stats options try to send multiple metrics to a
watch, which won't work with our simplified CW implementation
which expects exactly one Metric associated with each watch
(since that's all you can define via the template)
So quietly discard any metric data we aren't interested in.

ref bug 1133510

Change-Id: I5159611b96c501ff2d8e6e605cbd3d4ae5f77e48
"}]
commit_message:
heat engine : watchrule quietly discard unused metric data

Some cfn-push-stats options try to send multiple metrics to a
watch, which won't work with our simplified CW implementation
which expects exactly one Metric associated with each watch
(since that's all you can define via the template)
So quietly discard any metric data we aren't interested in.

ref bug 1133510

Change-Id: I5159611b96c501ff2d8e6e605cbd3d4ae5f77e48

commit_message:
Fix instance_system_metadata deleted columns

Migration 153 adds instance_type data to sys_meta, but creates entries
with the default value of deleted.. which is NULL.  This means these
entries do not get pulled in on a join when querying an instance, as
there is a condition of deleted=0.

This converts 'deleted' NULL entries to be 0.

Fixes bug 1147839

Change-Id: I3caf92b3992b22089a2653c2e7220585d616a102

commit_message:
Add time stamp to the captured tempest log

nosetests capturing the log output and displaying the log related to
ERRORed and FAILed test cases at the end of the test suite.
Without time stamp it is very difficult to find the correlation between the
tempest log and other log files...

Change-Id: I74e692548aff6e08128e9780cff1ba6e21040630

'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2013-02-09 16:13:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (16 inline comments)

Thanks for your work. The direction looks good.

- At the high level it would be better Loadbalancer panel is displayed when quantum loadbalancer extension is enabled.
Now Loadbalancer panel is always displayed when quantum is enabled. We may need to add another permission mechanism to do this.
- In general it is better to avoid displaying UUID in tables and use human friendly information instead (e.g., CIDR and network name in this case) as much as possible.
- api calls needs to be wrapped with try/except
- Unit tests for api/quantum needs to be added. It is found at openstack_dashboard/test/api_tests/quantum_tests.py

Thanks,
Akihiro'}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2013-02-09 23:44:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I agree with everything amotoki said.

Regarding his second point about not displaying the loadbalancer panel unless it's enabled, what we've done for other services so far is to add a setting to control it. See OPENSTACK_KEYSTONE_BACKEND and OPENSTACK_HYPERVISOR_FEATURES here: https://github.com/openstack/horizon/blob/master/openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example#L88

Adding another one of those for Quantum/Network would be appropriate.

Someday we'll be able to do proper querying of the services themselves to determine what capabilities are enabled, but for now a settings is fine."}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2013-02-11 19:09:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I agree with Akihiro's first two comments too. In fact, we had discussed this internally as to how to implement the check for the LBaaS service. Would it make sense to query the extensions, ideally Quantum should only return the extensions which are available.

On not using the UUIDs, I was thinking of concatenating network name, subnet name and UUID (or a similar combination that is more readable but maintains uniqueness)."}, {'account_id': 6832, 'date': '2013-02-14 02:11:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-14 02:14:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
blueprint quantum-lbaas

This implements the UI for quantum lbaas. Add/Delete Pool, Vip, Member,
PoolMonitor for lbaas is implemented.

Expected future extensions:
1. Update Vip/Pool/Member
2. Use of floating IP as VIP

Change-Id: Icde452b97a5e02d2381b996350b13aba3d87bb8e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-05 21:29:59.000000000', 'message': "Spread handoffs out better around zones.

Before, you'd get your 3* primary nodes in 3 different zones, and then
get_more_nodes would give you everything it could from a non-primary
zone, and then finish up with stuff from the primary zones. It would
sort of look like this:

P: device in a primary node's zone
N: device not in a primary node's zone

PPPNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNN...NNNNNNNNNPPP...PPPPPP

(The first three Ps are the primary nodes; they don't actually come
out of get_more_nodes(), but they're included for clarity.)

Now, the first few handoffs from get_more_nodes are in non-primary
zones, but only one per zone, and then the rest of the handoffs ignore
zones. It's still sampling the ring, so it's still taking weights into
consideration, but the zone distribution is more even early in the
handoff chain. It looks like this, assuming 10 zones:

P: device in a primary node's zone
N: device not in a primary node's zone
D: zone doesn't matter

PPPNNNNNNNDDDDDDDDDDD...DDD

* or whatever your replica count is

Change-Id: I31d2a2bc2cd6038386a2df85cd4fa37ccf2f650e
"}]
commit_message:
Spread handoffs out better around zones.

Before, you'd get your 3* primary nodes in 3 different zones, and then
get_more_nodes would give you everything it could from a non-primary
zone, and then finish up with stuff from the primary zones. It would
sort of look like this:

P: device in a primary node's zone
N: device not in a primary node's zone

PPPNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNN...NNNNNNNNNPPP...PPPPPP

(The first three Ps are the primary nodes; they don't actually come
out of get_more_nodes(), but they're included for clarity.)

Now, the first few handoffs from get_more_nodes are in non-primary
zones, but only one per zone, and then the rest of the handoffs ignore
zones. It's still sampling the ring, so it's still taking weights into
consideration, but the zone distribution is more even early in the
handoff chain. It looks like this, assuming 10 zones:

P: device in a primary node's zone
N: device not in a primary node's zone
D: zone doesn't matter

PPPNNNNNNNDDDDDDDDDDD...DDD

* or whatever your replica count is

Change-Id: I31d2a2bc2cd6038386a2df85cd4fa37ccf2f650e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-06 17:32:01.000000000', 'message': 'heat engine : Loadbalancer template watch reference should be Ref

Replace hard-coded reference to latency_watcher with Ref, otherwise
the name is not fully qualified for the nested stack and the engine
fails to lookup the watchrule

ref bug 1133510

Change-Id: If0352726ee89e2c8b78beb9436be36b811f1e1cd
'}]
commit_message:
heat engine : Loadbalancer template watch reference should be Ref

Replace hard-coded reference to latency_watcher with Ref, otherwise
the name is not fully qualified for the nested stack and the engine
fails to lookup the watchrule

ref bug 1133510

Change-Id: If0352726ee89e2c8b78beb9436be36b811f1e1cd

[{'created': '2013-03-06 10:59:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix minor typo in IPMI virt driver

The correct driver to use is:
    nova.virt.baremetal.ipmi.IPMI
instead of:
    nova.virt.baremetal.ipmi.Ipmi

Change-Id: I2bf11a3acb72f7c2ba37f1a03efe09f50dc9d239
'}]
commit_message:
Fix minor typo in IPMI virt driver

The correct driver to use is:
    nova.virt.baremetal.ipmi.IPMI
instead of:
    nova.virt.baremetal.ipmi.Ipmi

Change-Id: I2bf11a3acb72f7c2ba37f1a03efe09f50dc9d239

commit_message:
Have paramico to register the event pipe in time

paramiko is multi-thread package which has a dedicated thread for input
processing.
paramiko using a pipe trick to communicate his buffered_pipe state for
event based wait operations.
It is possible the reading (transport thread) gets an EOF (or CLOSE) message before
the event pipe created, unfourtunatly it leads to the EOF and CLOSE
messages not communicated correctly by the event pipe which is created later.

The applied change expected to be compatible with newer paramiko
versions, basically it haves the paramiko to create the pipe earlier.

test_integration_1 test case enabled.
Fixing bug ##1117555.

Change-Id: I5e7bff253ed21fc424acc426545cc48f22e96d74

commit_message:
Stash baremetal deploy image IDs in a namespace.

Baremetal PXE driver should read deploy_kernel_id & deploy_ramdisk_id
from the 'baremetal:' namespace within instance_type['extra_specs']
so that it doesn't conflict with ComputeCapabilitiesFilter any more.

This allows nova-compute to use ComputeCapabilitiesFilter with baremetal
again. For this filter to properly match the baremetal ndoe's RAM,
we need to tune two other Nova options for physical hardware.

Fixes bug 1129485.

Change-Id: I0aa1b0fef8ac59a06217577af8c747437d2d6bf5

[{'created': '2013-03-05 15:15:34.000000000', 'message': "Don't traceback in the API on invalid keypair.

When trying to get a keypair that did not exist, a traceback would end
up in the nova-api log.  Handle this exception in the API extension so
that it doesn't make a mess of the log.

Also add a unit test for this particular scenario.

Fix bug 1145545.

Change-Id: Id1647d4ac56629c2931099320d271e34fc2f99b9
"}]
commit_message:
Don't traceback in the API on invalid keypair.

When trying to get a keypair that did not exist, a traceback would end
up in the nova-api log.  Handle this exception in the API extension so
that it doesn't make a mess of the log.

Also add a unit test for this particular scenario.

Fix bug 1145545.

Change-Id: Id1647d4ac56629c2931099320d271e34fc2f99b9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-05 15:58:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix issues with re-raising exceptions.

There is complication with re-raising exceptions and our usage of
eventlet.  If the code in the exception handler accesses the db or rpc
in the exception handler, it will no longer be able to re-raise the
exception.  Using excutils.save_and_reraise_exception() works aorund
this issue.

The most common error is calling LOG.error() or LOG.exception(), as it
is possible for these to go access rpc.  There is an option to turn on
notifications for these errors.

Fix bug 845866.

Change-Id: Icfca2af63805711229249aa7abe60a938edd1b35
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issues with re-raising exceptions.

There is complication with re-raising exceptions and our usage of
eventlet.  If the code in the exception handler accesses the db or rpc
in the exception handler, it will no longer be able to re-raise the
exception.  Using excutils.save_and_reraise_exception() works aorund
this issue.

The most common error is calling LOG.error() or LOG.exception(), as it
is possible for these to go access rpc.  There is an option to turn on
notifications for these errors.

Fix bug 845866.

Change-Id: Icfca2af63805711229249aa7abe60a938edd1b35

commit_message:
Updating powervm driver snapshot with update_task_state flow

Fixes bug 1136359

Without this change snapshot still works but instance task state
does not get updated correctly and nova logs will show expected
task state erros from compute manager.

Also added a snapshot test.

Change-Id: I0f4ed24aa82a66fafc4b6813d017618ae07b4751

commit_message:
Switch to oslo.config.

The oslo-config package has been renamed. Switch to the new
version. (should fix SmokeStack).

Change-Id: Ic8cc9f53b7c4713e7bce7db47ad2021912d3b5db

[{'created': '2013-03-05 20:31:29.000000000', 'message': "Remove parameters containing passwords from Notifications.

compute.manager methods often takes password parameters in methods
that are wrapped with exception handlers and notifiers. What can
happen is these passwords will get bundled up and sent outside of
the system.

This patch will strip out any parameter with *_pass* in the name.

The side effect of this is that all notification will have the
error parameters in the 'args' part of the notification payload.
Previously only the positional args were in the 'args' part and
keyword args were placed in the payload directly.

This may affect consumers of the error notifications.

Change-Id: I2e7822eb5416d315ceb690f739e4dba9d52a7954
"}]
commit_message:
Remove parameters containing passwords from Notifications.

compute.manager methods often takes password parameters in methods
that are wrapped with exception handlers and notifiers. What can
happen is these passwords will get bundled up and sent outside of
the system.

This patch will strip out any parameter with *_pass* in the name.

The side effect of this is that all notification will have the
error parameters in the 'args' part of the notification payload.
Previously only the positional args were in the 'args' part and
keyword args were placed in the payload directly.

This may affect consumers of the error notifications.

Change-Id: I2e7822eb5416d315ceb690f739e4dba9d52a7954

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-05 15:53:27.000000000', 'message': 'Preserve exceptions in impl_zmq.

There is complication with re-raising exceptions and our usage of
eventlet.  If the code in the exception handler accesses the db or rpc
in the exception handler, it will no longer be able to re-raise the
exception.  Using excutils.save_and_reraise_exception() works aorund
this issue.

The most common error is calling LOG.error() or LOG.exception(), as it
is possible for these to go access rpc.  There is an option to turn on
notifications for these errors.

Fix bug 845866.

Change-Id: Ic914bba4703200ed114a42e3a55402883b430407
'}]
commit_message:
Preserve exceptions in impl_zmq.

There is complication with re-raising exceptions and our usage of
eventlet.  If the code in the exception handler accesses the db or rpc
in the exception handler, it will no longer be able to re-raise the
exception.  Using excutils.save_and_reraise_exception() works aorund
this issue.

The most common error is calling LOG.error() or LOG.exception(), as it
is possible for these to go access rpc.  There is an option to turn on
notifications for these errors.

Fix bug 845866.

Change-Id: Ic914bba4703200ed114a42e3a55402883b430407

commit_message:
Moved the configuration variables.

Moved the configuration variables from dhcp agent
to linux interface so l3-agent works with
Metadriver.

Also removed the unnecessary configuration variables
from quantum debug agent because of the above
modification.

Fixes: bug #1138757

Change-Id: Ib23fee18a08ef1c531feb05d98c9a76f5385a4ff

commit_message:
Update acls in the domain model

This change brings the domain model up to speed with the v1 stack by
issuing calls to store.set_acls whenever
 - an image is saved into the database (and locations are set)
 - a member is added to an image (and locations are set)

related blueprint glance-api-v2-image-sharing

Change-Id: I45f10752f6c04646b65f86e44b59bdeea534f024

commit_message:
Update resize confirmation statement to match impl

Update the docuemntation for resize to match the actual implementation.
The documentation was written before the implementation and has never
been accurate, the implementation has always requires an explicit
confirmation.

fixes bug 1146443

Change-Id: I8aaa7f269682b8e90239069dc1ea69a7a71ca273

commit_message:
Work better in server env with no keyrings

We should not try loading keyrings if we dont' have to. We
certainly should not print messages if keyrings are not even
needed

Fix for LP# 1145071

Change-Id: I700a2b40620359f6f1fbe03c6a6239d162ddea61

commit_message:
Generate notification for cached v2 download

Cached v2 image downloads were not generating notifications.
For now use a 'size_checked_iter' to generate a
notification.

Fix for bug 1132755.

Change-Id: Iec01efb93d7a1853973d355221d06fad9631afd7

glance_http.py:
* We import the json module in all other files without a fall back
  the glance client should not be different
* The detailed message for the exceptions are generated, but not used.

image_client.py:
* 'time' package is a not used import.

container_client.py:
* 'marker' variable not in use.

test_absolute_limits.py:
* 'testtools' import not in use.

* 'rand_name' imported, but not used.

test_authorization.py:
finally blocks expect the negative test are allocated resources,
however it is more likely they raises a different error.
The finally block hided the orginal exception!
The removed finally blocks referenced to not existing variables.

Change-Id: I3f543d8d49c92d136f4cff07a776242329eb5ec4

commit_message:
Small fixes around variable usage

glance_http.py:
* We import the json module in all other files without a fall back
  the glance client should not be different
* The detailed message for the exceptions are generated, but not used.

image_client.py:
* 'time' package is a not used import.

container_client.py:
* 'marker' variable not in use.

test_absolute_limits.py:
* 'testtools' import not in use.

test_disk_config.py, test_server_personality.py:
* 'rand_name' imported, but not used.

Change-Id: I3f543d8d49c92d136f4cff07a776242329eb5ec4

commit_message:
Fix an invalid test in the storage test suite

The test_by_user_period test is looking for the first
result set to come back with the wrong timestampe, and
not noticing that most of the test isn't even being
run. Be more explicit about the expected results.

Change-Id: I47e7699c877819d98f66d47dc85662f26767abd6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
heat engine : Ensure properties validation is caught

Rework usage of properties.validate() so that we always
catch the error and set the resource state to failed when
a properties validation error occurs

fixes bug 1146529

Change-Id: I4c5b24cc29a19a5170852aa7626031f9612b3272

commit_message:
Avoid multiline import statement in cisco exts.

Updates the cisco credential extension to avoid use of
a multi-line import statement. This was causing RPM build errors.

Fixes LP Bug #1148252.

Change-Id: I5e2e5ea3e85fc536272278c358e932c65af9d2f7

all converted to unicode. The scheduler will then check, for example,

always return False. This is an issue for the 'QoS_support' flag, so

commit_message:
Change QoS_support values to strings.

Boolean values for capabilities don't work because extra_specs are
all converted to unicode. The scheduler will then check, for example,
if the boolean 'True' is equal to the unicode string 'True', and will
always return False. This is an issue for the 'QoS_support' flag, so
change all QoS_support values to the equivalent strings.

Fixes bug: 1146306

Change-Id: I273e9fb46c83e6bfb7e56e195c26ea8d1da0cd66

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-03 10:56:45.000000000', 'message': 'Support multiple role selection in projects

Horizon currently overwrites existing roles when saving project
membership. The backend was only initialising the form with the
first role of each user, so when the form was submitted any other
roles on *all* users were removed.

Changes:
- Fix backend to pass through all roles
- Keep role dropdown open on click, clicks add a tick to a role
- Show the first two roles on the dropdown label, add a "..." for
   three or more.

Fixes bug #1081374.

Change-Id: Iaf64afc4c50d4d24d6acb529a6e810a0ba154505
'}]
commit_message:
Support multiple role selection in projects

Horizon currently overwrites existing roles when saving project
membership. The backend was only initialising the form with the
first role of each user, so when the form was submitted any other
roles on *all* users were removed.

Changes:
- Fix backend to pass through all roles
- Keep role dropdown open on click, clicks add a tick to a role
- Show the first two roles on the dropdown label, add a "..." for
   three or more.

Fixes bug #1081374.

Change-Id: Iaf64afc4c50d4d24d6acb529a6e810a0ba154505

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-04 22:50:25.000000000', 'message': 'Allow non-admin users to clear router gateway properly

Fixes bug 1131193

In Grizzly-3 milestone, quantum made a change to allow regular users to
set non-owned external network as router gateway, but Horizon Quantum
router support cannot handle it, particularily non-admin user cannot clear
router gateway. This means non-admin cannot delete a router as a result.
In addition, there is no way for non-admin users to check if router gateway
is set or not since a non-admin user cannot see a router gateway.

To address the above issues, this commit does the following changes:
- Display "external gateway info" in router detail panel
  to allow non-admin users to see a router gateway (external network)
- Move "Set/Clear Gateway" button from router detail to router table
  and each button is displayed based on an existence of router gateway.

Change-Id: Ib096d5e40c88b8a605ad8aae26d1f5cf7fd745e6
'}, {'created': '2013-03-05 07:15:46.000000000', 'message': 'Allow non-admin users to clear router gateway properly

clear router gateway. This means non-admin cannot delete a router as
a result. In addition, there is no way for non-admin users to check
if router gateway is set or not since a non-admin user cannot see
a router gateway.

To address the above issues, this commit does the following changes:
- Display "external gateway info" in router table and detail to allow
  non-admin users to check if a router is connected to an external

commit_message:
Allow non-admin users to clear router gateway properly

Fixes bug 1131193

In Grizzly-3 milestone, quantum made a change to allow regular users
to set non-owned external network as router gateway, but Quantum
router support cannot handle it, particularily non-admin user cannot
clear router gateway. This means non-admin cannot delete a router as
a result. In addition, there is no way for non-admin users to check
if router gateway is set or not since a non-admin user cannot see
a router gateway.

To address the above issues, this commit does the following changes:
- Display "external gateway info" in router table and detail to allow
  non-admin users to check if a router is connected to an external
  network (i.e., a router has a default gateway).
- Move "Set/Clear Gateway" button to router table and Set/Clear
  button is displayed based on an existence of router gateway.
- Move "Set/Clear Gateway" button in Admin panel in the same way
  to keep consistency with Project panel.

Change-Id: Ib096d5e40c88b8a605ad8aae26d1f5cf7fd745e6

commit_message:
keystone : Use Ec2Signer utility class from keystoneclient

The Ec2Signer class has been moved to python-keystoneclient,
so we can remove the internal implementation and import the
keystoneclient version

blueprint ec2signer-to-keystoneclient

Change-Id: I19d8575ab8b972467ce280a6197ae762da1ce790

commit_message:
Populate default explicit allow rules for egress

This way, the default behavior becomes clear and
symmetric to ingress processing.

Fixes bug 1143283

Change-Id: Id6496819aaceda50def597739f7872653d5b2e00

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-19 16:07:24.000000000', 'message': "Save test_auth_token_middleware from unlimited recursion

For Python 2.6, BaseAuthTokenMiddlewareTest will be
equal to AdjustedBaseAuthTokenMiddlewareTest in
BaseAuthTokenMiddlewareTest.setUp thus leading to
infinite recursion.

Also, parent's setUp was incorrectly called by
BaseAuthTokenMiddlewareTest.setUp twice: at the beginning
and at the end of the function.

Change-Id: I63fce65866ef9d8aebe9eb60f7ceb17463de0989
Fixes: bug #1130200
"}]
commit_message:
Save test_auth_token_middleware from unlimited recursion

For Python 2.6, BaseAuthTokenMiddlewareTest will be
equal to AdjustedBaseAuthTokenMiddlewareTest in
BaseAuthTokenMiddlewareTest.setUp thus leading to
infinite recursion.

Also, parent's setUp was incorrectly called by
BaseAuthTokenMiddlewareTest.setUp twice: at the beginning
and at the end of the function.

Change-Id: I63fce65866ef9d8aebe9eb60f7ceb17463de0989
Fixes: bug #1130200

commit_message:
Fix syntax error in credential.py and missing __init__.py

This patch fixes a syntax error in credential.py and resolves
the following import error:

In [1]: from quantum.plugins.cisco.extensions import _credential_view as a
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ImportError                               Traceback (most recent call last)
/opt/stack/quantum/<ipython-input-1-ef3f11a361d0> in <module>()
----> 1 from quantum.plugins.cisco.extensions import _credential_view as a

Fixes bug 1148133

Change-Id: I22bc7152fcfec6fdc9f2638bc92d2fb1db99a484

commit_message:
NetApp: Fix for snapshot not deleted in error state.

This fix enables cleaning of volumes/snapshots
in error state by allowing them to delete.
It will allow the delete call to be
successful if snapshot/volume are in
error state. This also fixes the bug
raised recently with  number 1145409 which seems
to be duplicate of 1143661.

bug 1143661
bug 1145409

Change-Id: I38bc13e676404f96db54b12edfa56680489e893e

commit_message:
Set the version range for prettytable dependency

devstack has been failing to install because the
dependency for prettytable here is not fixed and
results in a newer version being installed than
the other projects allow.

Change-Id: I464492e4f15b580d735aa704076d471f4b01811e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

subject: use wsgi.file_wrapper in object server
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-22 20:58:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/22740/1/check/gate-swift-pep8/1585 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22740/1/check/gate-swift-docs/1439 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22740/1/check/gate-swift-python26/1685 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22740/1/check/gate-swift-python27/1689 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22740/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-full/5124 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22740/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-quantum/9722 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/22740/1/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-postgres-full/4843 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 597, 'date': '2013-02-23 17:27:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is good for what it is, but where is the actual implementation (that sets wsgi.file_wrapper)? I imagine the thing that is set should be in swift.obj.server.DiskFile somewhere. Otherwise I don't quite see the point of having this supported."}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-02-24 03:55:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's something that can be implemented by a clever wsgi server.  The server puts a file_wrapper class in the environment, then if it gets an instance of that class back from the app, it knows to extract the fileno from the object and serve it with sendfile or aio+async networking or whatever."}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-02-27 01:12:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think this breaks range requests. DiskFile has all this app_iter_range and app_iter_ranges stuff that swob.Response looks for if there's a Range: header, but whatever magical file_wrapper class we find is almost certain not to have any of that.

It looks like range requests would just end up getting a 200 back, but I haven't tried it."}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-02-27 01:57:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, googling shows WSGI servers are all over the map about this.  The WSGI spec will never stop torturing me.  This works fine on my server, but apparently other people read the same spec and get a completely different idea.

Maybe I'll try something like just cramming the file name in 'swift.data_file' env, then it'll generally be ignored, but you can write middleware to translate that into X-Sendfile or file_wrapper or whatever actually works on the server you're using."}, {'account_id': 2828, 'date': '2013-02-27 01:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-06 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-03-06 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
use wsgi.file_wrapper in object server

If there's a wsgi.file_wrapper class available, it should be used
so files can be served from the object server with sendfile()
or whatever.

http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0333/#optional-platform-specific-file-handling

Change-Id: I5dd8ef4c3683d8f249c09084d16872a07a759b9b

commit_message:
Client for NAS features.

This commit holds the code for the client side of NAS enhancements
at I37cb542d13002687ecbfe7c7f3e0e7eb7cecbc03. The new CLI comands
added are:

  share-create        --  Create new NAS (CIFS or NFS) storage
  share-delete        --  Delete NAS storage
  share-list          --  List all NAS shares
  share-allow         --  Allow access to a share
  share-deny          --  Deny access to a share
  share-access-list   --  Show access list for shares
  share-show          --  Show details about a NAS share

Implements blueprint cinder-protocol-enhancements

Change-Id: I1a14aaed9870e3902aed1b6ea77260c75f327785

Currently, if we give an invalid AZ to create an instance, HTTP 202 is return,
this is not proper, so checking the given AZ before creating and return HTTP

commit_message:
Return HTTP 400 Bad Request when invalid AZ is given

Currently, if we give an invalid AZ to create an instance, HTTP 202 is return,
this is not proper, so checking the given AZ before creating and return HTTP
400 if the AZ is invalid.

Fixes bug #891435

Change-Id: I50b88b95270bdc0f50565660bb60dd2d5d6a6380

"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-02-27 03:05:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (2 inline comments)

Very Cool.

However, you are assuming a much greater degree of up-front confirmation than a trust will actually do.  There is no reason to enforce that the items of the trust (project, roles, etc)  already exist as they are not used until the trust is executed.  Roles assignments in particular may come and go multiple times between when a trust is created and when it is executed.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2013-02-27 04:58:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (3 inline comments)

'}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2013-02-27 14:29:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (5 inline comments)

So trusts are mutable until they are consumed? In that case, it makes way more sense to have full CRUD on both /trusts/{trust_id} and /trusts/{trust_id}/roles with PUT & DELETE  just like we do in the rest of the API, rather than submitting a list of roles on POST /trusts. Keystone can internally track whether a trust has been consumed and when to stop accepting PUT & PATCH requests against it then? (and return 403 for those calls?)'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-02-27 14:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (5 inline comments)

if i control two user accounts, can i use trusts to bypass the normal token expiration? or, can i setup a trust with my own user account to do so?'}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2013-01-25 03:07:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

"if i control two user accounts, can i use trusts to bypass the normal token expiration? or, can i setup a trust with my own user account to do so?"


No.  You need a token to get a token from a trust.  THe token produced by the trust has a lifespan that matches that of the users original token.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2013-02-01 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

'}, {'created': '2013-02-22 19:14:13.000000000', 'message': "Trusts

Blueprint trusts

creates a trust.  Using a trust, one user (the trustee), can then
create tokens with a subset of another user's (the trustor) roles and
projects.
If the impersonate flag in the trust is set, the token user_id is set
to the trustor's user ID
If the impersonate flag is not set, the token's user_is is set to the
trustee's user ID

sql and kvs backends
sql upgrade scripts
unit tests for backends, auth and v3 api
imodifications to the trust controller for creating tokens
Authenticates only user can be trustor in create
Deleting a trust invalidates all tokens created from that trust
Adds the trust id and the id of the trustee to the header of the token
policy rules for trust

Change-Id: I5745f4d9a4180b59671a143a55ed87019e98ec76
"}, {'created': '2013-02-25 02:43:41.000000000', 'message': "Trusts

Blueprint trusts

creates a trust.  Using a trust, one user (the trustee), can then
create tokens with a subset of another user's (the trustor) roles and
projects.
If the impersonate flag in the trust is set, the token user_id is set
to the trustor's user ID
If the impersonate flag is not set, the token's user_is is set to the
trustee's user ID

check that both trustor and trustee are enabled prior to creating
the trust token.

Only role {'id': '0f0f0d'} is supported for adding roles.

Change-Id: I5745f4d9a4180b59671a143a55ed87019e98ec76
"}, {'created': '2013-02-27 01:52:18.000000000', 'message': "Trusts

Blueprint trusts

creates a trust.  Using a trust, one user (the trustee), can then
create tokens with a subset of another user's (the trustor) roles and
projects.
If the impersonate flag in the trust is set, the token user_id is set
to the trustor's user ID
If the impersonate flag is not set, the token's user_is is set to the
trustee's user ID

check that both trustor and trustee are enabled prior to creating
the trust token.

sql and kvs backends

unit tests for backends, auth and v3 api
imodifications to the trust controller for creating tokens

Adds the trust id and the id of the trustee to the header of the token

breaks the PEP8 check

commit_message:
Trusts

Blueprint trusts

creates a trust.  Using a trust, one user (the trustee), can then
create tokens with a subset of another user's (the trustor) roles and
projects.
If the impersonate flag in the trust is set, the token user_id is set
to the trustor's user ID
If the impersonate flag is not set, the token's user_is is set to the
trustee's user ID

check that both trustor and trustee are enabled prior to creating
the trust token.

sql and kvs backends
sql upgrade scripts
unit tests for backends, auth and v3 api
modifications to the trust controller for creating tokens
Authenticates that only user can be trustor in create
Deleting a trust invalidates all tokens created from that trust
Adds the trust id and the id of the trustee to the header of the token
policy rules for trust

This version has a workaround for testing against the KVS version
of the Service catalog

Change-Id: I5745f4d9a4180b59671a143a55ed87019e98ec76

commit_message:
bug 1134802: fix inconsistent format for expires_at and issued_at

Notice we have to use fraction of second precision to prevent PKI token ID
overlap.

Change-Id: Icfc192c08ab5b4db02547ef6f077fa7f32210835

commit_message:
Add common test base class to hold common things.

There are several common fixtures that every test case wants. Following
the pattern in Nova, add a common base test case class to hold these things.

Change-Id: I2d2cd91e5051d9cbf230e6f48985d6eddcb7b58a

commit_message:
sync oslo changes for setup / version

this fixes the fact that run_tests.sh wouldn't work in a venv with
a clean cinder checkout. Yay for fixing being able to run tests.

Fixes bug #1125416

Change-Id: Ic341c3b878cc566f8d2f6a3b2c9d1fa62fc52261

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-02-11 18:55:34.000000000', 'message': "Avoid dangling partial image on size/checksum mismatch

Fixes bug 1122299

Previously, when the supplied image size or checksum didn't match
the calculated values, partial image image data was left dangling
in the backend store.

Now, we clean up when the mismatch is detected.

Change-Id: I916d78ef3b2065e87df31ec4fb405915417d68aa
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid dangling partial image on size/checksum mismatch

Fixes bug 1122299

Previously, when the supplied image size or checksum didn't match
the calculated values, partial image image data was left dangling
in the backend store.

Now, we clean up when the mismatch is detected.

Change-Id: I916d78ef3b2065e87df31ec4fb405915417d68aa

commit_message:
A test for concurrency when glance uses sleep.

Bug 988099 showed that time.sleep was not being monkey patched
resulting in no concurrency when a sleep was called.  This was
fixed with change I24dfe818.  This commit provides a regression
test to ensure that this behavior remains in place as glance is
developed over time.

Change-Id: Iafbfaa9fd672b5ffd1d19a43dee03dfbfc6d3a2d

[{'created': '2013-02-19 14:23:03.000000000', 'message': 'Swallow UserWarning from glance-cache-manage

Fixes bug 1129445

Previously, we exposed internal technical debt as an apparent
user-facing warning.

Now the warning is swallowed in the internal case, but continues
to be seen by external users of this library.

Note that this fix is not relevant on master, as that the warning
no longer occurs in that case.

Change-Id: I30a835e0024acac8841b4746968abe7cae9e14cb
'}]
commit_message:
Swallow UserWarning from glance-cache-manage

Fixes bug 1129445

Previously, we exposed internal technical debt as an apparent
user-facing warning.

Now the warning is swallowed in the internal case, but continues
to be seen by external users of this library.

Note that this fix is not relevant on master, as that the warning
no longer occurs in that case.

Change-Id: I30a835e0024acac8841b4746968abe7cae9e14cb

"}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2013-02-25 15:32:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I wonder if it might be better to normalize the timing by the byte count of the object which was PUT.  This would help smooth out "legitimate" long transfers of large files.  You would essentially be monitoring the inverse of transfer rate (so higher numbers are bad).  I think that'll have a higher signal-to-noise ratio for detecting bad drives.

To keep the actual numbers from being too small, you'd probably also want to multiply by 1000, making the metric's unit be ms/kB (milliseconds per kilobyte), which would also need to be documented in that Admin Guide table.'}, {'account_id': 6655, 'date': '2013-02-26 07:59:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-02-26 08:00:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

lgtm!'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-02-28 20:04:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

Peter: Yes, a slow client will lengthen the time it takes to transfer a file, and so that device's metrics will be lower than they otherwise would be. 

However, I don't think it matters. Remember that a PUT request goes to 3 separate drives in a cluster, and so a slow client will lower the PUT.$device.timing metric for 3 drives as it uploads. Further, unless the PUT requests are all for the same object, the slowness will tend to spread around the cluster.

What an operator would look for would be a single disk whose object PUTs take way, way longer than anyone else's, as that's the signature of a failing drive. I think that'll show up really clearly in these stats even if clients are running at a range of speeds, even to the point of having many gigabit-connected LAN clients and one guy tethered on his cell phone."}, {'account_id': 6655, 'date': '2013-03-01 12:12:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Samuel:
Yes, single disk PUT timing is very important to identify failing drives. But seperating the client speed and disk put timing may also be helpfull, considering NIC bonding usually used in storage node, and one of the bonding link may be down, which makes the client speed varies.'}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-03-01 15:30:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

For this timing feature, would a configurable parameter
be nicer in case someone does not really want to timing
it especially this is in the very core of Swift. I would
prefer to add a configurable parameter or tied this with
monitoring config parameters if there is one."}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2013-03-01 15:56:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This seems fine to me; there should already be config options for this type of monitoring. For instance, we already had a different kind of monitoring going at our company, so we've never turned this particular type on."}, {'account_id': 2860, 'date': '2013-03-01 19:53:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: No score

gholt, I am not seeing anywhere it checked the config
parameter prior the execution of the code though.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-01 20:04:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

StatsD data emitters (logger.timing(), logger.timing_since(), logger.increment(), et cetera) don't actually emit data unless log_statsd_host and friends are set in the configuration*. It's true that this particular piece of StatsD data isn't independently configurable, but IMHO it's not necessary to do so. If a deployer is running the StatsD stuff into Graphite, then there's ways** of filtering the incoming metrics to get only the interesting ones. Other metric consumers are likely to have similar options.

* swift/common/utils.py:774 for all the details.

** http://graphite.readthedocs.org/en/1.0/config-carbon.html#whitelist-and-blacklist for example"}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2013-03-05 23:16:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-05 23:18:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: No score

commit_message:
Added per disk PUT timing monitoring support.

Fixes bug 1104708

There could be severe performance drop for swift is one disk of one
storage node is problematic due to the tragic state of async disk I/O.

This patch provided PUT timing per kB transfered (ms/kB) monitoring
support for each non-zero-byte request of each disk and report to
statsD for alert.
-adding "object-server.PUT.<device>.timing" metrics for object-server.

DocImpact.

Change-Id: Ie94bddad28e8be52e71683bf6c9db988664abe47

commit_message:
fix incorrect pathname

return of call to os.path.abspath('../../..') depends on the setup of
nose working directory. Change to return the directory where
test_config.py resides

fixes: bug #1138216
Change-Id: I1d3f1e3c88bd30871a018a195cee46a91d35c8a8

Hi, Davanum,
I test with xml in the testcase as below:

I use minidom test first:

xml.dom.minidom.parseString("<!DOCTYPE x [<!ENTITY a '%(a)s'><!ENTITY b '%(b)s'><!ENTITY c '%(c)s'>]><foo><bar><v1>%(d)s</v1></bar></foo>" % {'a': 'A'*10, 'b': '&a;'*10, 'c': '&b;'*10, 'd':'&c;'*9999})

This will spend about 10 seconds. That means this is the bug?

But I test with etree, it returns almost immediately 

etree.fromstring("<!DOCTYPE x [<!ENTITY a '%(a)s'><!ENTITY b '%(b)s'><!ENTITY c '%(c)s'>]><foo><bar><v1>%(d)s</v1></bar></foo>" % {'a': 'A'*10, 'b': '&a;'*10, 'c': '&b;'*10, 'd':'&c;'*9999})

commit_message:
Prevent DoS through XML entity expansion

Add a ProtectedXMLParser that overrides the
doctype declaration handler. The handler simply
throws an exception and prevents any further
parsing of the incoming xml.

Fixes LP Bug #1100282

Change-Id: I6488e1a6a52326006e7e7927ece5b5939b72e83e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-05 10:10:55.000000000', 'message': 'Adjusts reclaim instance interval of deferred delete tests

All deferred delete tests set reclaim_instance_interval to 1. This is
fine for the test_deferred_delete test that depends on the periodic
task _reclaim_queued_deletes to run.

For the other tests however, in the unlikely event that the periodic
task do run before the tests are done, it will interfere with the tests
by terminating the instance in the middle of it.

By setting the interval longer than the actual test run, this can be
avoided.

Resolves bug 1146510.

Change-Id: I606cd9f3277cc86cf4f9811da2a10efc7433b9d0
'}]
commit_message:
Adjusts reclaim instance interval of deferred delete tests

All deferred delete tests set reclaim_instance_interval to 1. This is
fine for the test_deferred_delete test that depends on the periodic
task _reclaim_queued_deletes to run.

For the other tests however, in the unlikely event that the periodic
task do run before the tests are done, it will interfere with the tests
by terminating the instance in the middle of it.

By setting the interval longer than the actual test run, this can be
avoided.

Resolves bug 1146510.

Change-Id: I606cd9f3277cc86cf4f9811da2a10efc7433b9d0

commit_message:
Refactor leaky abstractions

Prior to this change, it was common for a domain layer that was wrapping
Image objects returned by methods to neglect to unwrap the objects on
the way in to other methods.

This change fixes that by making proxy base classes less leaky and
inheriting from them in the various domain layers.

Change-Id: I22866cdd800c4c95b43c92762ead3775cffeaa80

"}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-03-02 22:38:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

This patch requires the latest https://github.com/openstack/oslo-config

See: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1140310'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-04 10:12:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This commit does not appear to be merely renaming options. In addition to the rename, you have split one option into two - hyperv_wait_between_attach_retry now appears to be replaced by volume_attach_retry_interval and volume_attach_wait_time. Please make such a functional change separately from any renames.

I also question whether this is really justified to break the feature freeze. This is really just style cleanup so I find it hard to think why it couldn't just wait until Havana, when we could do a mass conversion of all virt drivers to use groups for their config."}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-03-04 10:15:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We discussed already about this on IRC and on the ML and there was consensus on pushing it for Grizzly'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-04 11:03:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Can you post a link to the mailing list discussion, so reviewers can see this conclusion, as many won't be reading every mail on the list and so won't have noticed this decision."}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-03-04 11:09:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Sure: here's the related ML thread. Further conversations went on on IRC."}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-03-04 11:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Ops, missing link :-) 

http://markmail.org/message/qkjbpqbtfwjf4sjy'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-04 13:18:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I just pushed the oslo-config 2013.1b5 tag which has support for deprecated group - http://tarballs.openstack.org/oslo-config/oslo-config-2013.1b5.tar.gz'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-04 13:58:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Since this patch is why 2013.1b5 is required, it makes sense to bump to 2013.1b5 in pip-requires in this patch'}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-03-05 11:57:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rebased'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-05 11:58:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Automatically re-added by Gerrit trivial rebase detection script."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-05 12:01:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I accept that people seem to think this is fine to break the freeze. My remaining point still stands though - as well as doing a rename, this patch is splitting one option into 2 new options. Such a functional change should be done as a separate patch from the non-functional renaming.'}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-03-05 12:05:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Daniel,

ok np, I'm splitting them. The additional option is due to the fact that a dev used a an option in a place where it doesn't make sense at all instead of creating an ad hoc one."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-05 12:36:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

If you're going to split out the hyperv_wait_between_attach_retry change, you should probably do it soon since the closer we get to RCs, the less likely this moving of options will be accepted

Also, the hyperv_wait_between_attach_retry change should come after the change to add the hyperv section - that way we can delay that change until Havana if needed

Also, can we please call this 'hyperv' instead of 'HYPERV'. I don't think we need to shout :)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2013-03-05 12:57:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build succeeded.

- http://logs.openstack.org/23352/2/check/gate-nova-pep8/22220 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/23352/2/check/gate-nova-pylint/9104 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-03-05 13:17:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Mark,

By convention the sections are upper case in ini files, see for example [DEFAULT]. If you look at Quantum.conf file, all sections are upper case. In Nova we already have at least one option in [HYPERV].

IMO we should be as consistent as possible with the rest of OpenStack.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-05 13:22:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I tend to agree with both of you. I would prefer lowercase, but given that we seem to already have a defacto standard of using uppercase.

Unless of course we want to rename all existing sections which are uppercase, to be lowercase too ?

Whichever we decide on, we must enforce consistency of capitalization across all sections we have.'}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-03-05 13:26:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'd add that we should enforce it as an OpenStack wide default practice. 

From a user's perspective it's quite awful to name sections in uppercase in Quantum and lowercase in Nova, as an example.

Beside that, since [DEFAULT] is uppercase, IMHO that should be the default for the other sections as well. Sorry, the DEFAULT. :-)"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2013-03-05 13:35:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Quantum is the outlier here - IMHO they should be using lowercase too

Here's the groups we have in nova now:

 [HYPERV]
 [conductor]
 [cells]
 [zookeeper]
 [baremetal]
 [rpc_notifier2]
 [trusted_computing]
 [vmware]
 [spice]"}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-05 13:37:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ok, clearly I should have done better research on Nova usage :-) Given that balance of upper/lower case in Nova, I agree we should be using 'hyperv' not "HYPERV".'}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2013-03-05 14:58:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2013-03-05 15:02:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-02 22:18:35.000000000', 'message': 'Moves Hyper-V options to the HYPERV section

Fixes Bug: 1140778

Due to the large number of options available in Nova, in order to
achieve better option organization and naming (e.g. avoid the hyperv_*
prefix) and to avoid option name clashes, options specific to the
Hyper-V driver are moved to a section named "HYPERV".

Backwards compatibility is mantained by providing the "deprecated_group"
argument in option definitions.

Change-Id: If2710822cdf6e4ae108a6d1e7977735ac8104a2e
'}, {'created': '2013-03-02 22:18:35.000000000', 'message': 'Moves Hyper-V options to the HYPERV section

Fixes Bug: 1140778

Due to the large number of options available in Nova, in order to
achieve better option organization and naming (e.g. avoid the hyperv_*
prefix) and to avoid option name clashes, options specific to the
Hyper-V driver are moved to a section named "HYPERV".

Backwards compatibility is mantained by providing the "deprecated_group"
argument in option definitions.

Change-Id: If2710822cdf6e4ae108a6d1e7977735ac8104a2e

commit_message:
Moves Hyper-V options to the hyperv section

Fixes Bug: 1140778

Due to the large number of options available in Nova, in order to
achieve better option organization and naming (e.g. avoid the hyperv_*
prefix) and to avoid option name clashes, options specific to the
Hyper-V driver are moved to a section named "hyperv".

Backwards compatibility is mantained by providing the "deprecated_group"
argument in option definitions.

For case consistency the group name as been changed to "hyperv" for options
introduced in Grizzly belonging to the group "HYPERV"

Change-Id: If2710822cdf6e4ae108a6d1e7977735ac8104a2e

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-04 10:13:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes disk size issue during image boot on Hyper-V

Fixes bug: 1135155

The local root disk size provided in the instance flavor was not properly
taken into account in the Hyper-V driver, this patches provides a
fix for this feature.

In order to resize VHD images with differencing disks (CoW), the cached
base disk is copied to a new file, which is resized to the size
specified in the flavor and cached. This is necessary due to the fact that
differencing VHD disks cannot be resized.

The procedure described above is applied during image spawn, resize and
live migration as needed.

Trying to spawn an instance with a local root disk size smaller than the
image VHD max. internal size will result in an error.

Change-Id: I04f18f0e25c92ed1e1f9f6f18750329a3f9f1711
'}, {'created': '2013-03-04 11:18:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes disk size issue during image boot on Hyper-V

The local root disk size provided in the instance flavor was not properly
taken into account in the Hyper-V driver, this patches provides a
fix for this feature.

In order to resize VHD images with differencing disks (CoW), the cached
base disk is copied to a new file, which is resized to the size
specified in the flavor and cached. This is necessary due to the fact that
differencing VHD disks cannot be resized.

The procedure described above is applied during image spawn, resize and
live migration as needed.

Trying to spawn an instance with a local root disk size smaller than the
image VHD max. internal size will result in an error.

Change-Id: I04f18f0e25c92ed1e1f9f6f18750329a3f9f1711
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes disk size issue during image boot on Hyper-V

Fixes bug: 1135155

The local root disk size provided in the instance flavor was not properly
taken into account in the Hyper-V driver, this patches provides a
fix for this feature.

In order to resize VHD images with differencing disks (CoW), the cached
base disk is copied to a new file, which is resized to the size
specified in the flavor and cached. This is necessary due to the fact that
differencing VHD disks cannot be resized.

The procedure described above is applied during image spawn, resize and
live migration as needed.

Trying to spawn an instance with a local root disk size smaller than the
image VHD max. internal size will result in an error.

Change-Id: I04f18f0e25c92ed1e1f9f6f18750329a3f9f1711

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-02-23 18:28:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Copying a comment over from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22741/ :

I'm also interested in opinions on the rpc API changes from other reviewers.
The issue here is that while the rpc API is versioned, we can't bump it like we normally would in a change against master, because the version numbers already have a meaning as the API has progressed in master. So, the approach here is to just punt by not messing with the version number and just making sure changes are at least backwards compatible.
The downside isn't *that* bad, really. If a newer client sends a message to an older service that hasn't received this update, it will fail just as it would have it if were versioned. The exception that comes back will be something like a TypeError or AttributeError, depending on which method is called, instead of an rpc version error with a message explaining the API version mismatch.
In the past we have just avoided making rpc API changes in stable branches, just like db migrations. In this case, it's a security issue so I think we need to. I think this approach is acceptable, but would love to hear other ideas if anyone has any."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2013-02-23 18:29:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

commit_message:
VNC Token Validation

Force console auth service to flush all tokens
associated with an instance when it is deleted.
This will fix a bug where the console for the
wrong instance can be connected to via the console
if the correct circumstances occur. This change also
makes a call to veriry vnc console tokens when a
user attempts to connect to a console. This ensures
the user is connecting to the correct console.

bug 1125378
Change-Id: I0d83ec6c4dbfef1af912a200ee15f8052f72da96

Change-Id: I2c8dc2bc3e3055e529bdaf38529d804f5e75e036
'}, {'created': '2013-03-06 01:00:18.000000000', 'message': 'Imports missing opts in test modules

Added options used by test modules that were previously imported elsewhere

Script to run all tests independantly:
find quantum/tests/ -type f ! -name "__init__.py" \
! -name "test_ovs_tunnel.py" \
! -name "test_metaplugin.py" \
-name "test_*py" | sed 's/quantum\/tests\/unit\///' | \
xargs --max-args=1 ./run_tests.sh -P

NOTE: test_ovs_tunnel and test_metaplugin have issues running independantly

Change-Id: I2c8dc2bc3e3055e529bdaf38529d804f5e75e036
'}]
commit_message:
Delete DATABASE option checkup testcases

Fixes bug #1146441

Change-Id: I2c8dc2bc3e3055e529bdaf38529d804f5e75e036

commit_message:
Integrate os-refresh-config with heat-cfntools

* Provide entry point for Heat Metadata to drive os-refresh-config
* Use os-config-applier for configuring heat cfn tools

commit_message:
local-config element adds authorized_key for root:

Currently, the local-config and stackuser elements
are intertwined.  local-config installs an authorized_key
for stackuser, if the stackuser element is in use.

This change does two things:
- add authorized_key for root from local-config element,
    regardeless of whether stackuser element is in use.
- install key for stack user from stackuser element,
    only if local-config element is in use.

Change-Id: I0d07b61404119ea0650c5c0fb98d6786adcf3ca9

Add quantum_available config option

This lets us globally enable or disable tests that require quantum.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-03 09:01:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes issues found in /os-hosts API

There are some issues found in Cinder /os-hosts API:

1) Bracket in the wrong spot in Cinder HostController show method
There is an erroneous bracket on the following line in the show method
that should be at the end of the response:
   'total_volume_gb': str(sum)},

2) XML Attributes Missing for List/Index method in Cinder HostController
The HostIndexTemplate class specifies mapping for "host" and "topic"
attributes rather than any of the ones that are actually returned from
the index method.

3) XML Serialization is commented for Cinder HostController show method

Fixes Bug: 1139984

Change-Id: I881e80b5e109ed6ddcc4f7c4bf5749ab6dca563d

2) XML Attributes Missing for List/Index method in Cinder HostController
The HostIndexTemplate class specifies mapping for "host" and "topic"
attributes rather than any of the ones that are actually returned from

commit_message:
Fixes issues found in /os-hosts API

There are some issues found in Cinder /os-hosts API:

1) Bracket in the wrong spot in Cinder HostController show method
There is an erroneous bracket on the following line in the show method
that should be at the end of the response:
   'total_volume_gb': str(sum)},

2) XML Attributes Missing for List/Index method in Cinder HostController
The HostIndexTemplate class specifies mapping for "host" and "topic"
attributes rather than any of the ones that are actually returned from
the index method.

3) XML Serialization is commented for Cinder HostController show method

Fixes Bug: 1139984

Change-Id: I881e80b5e109ed6ddcc4f7c4bf5749ab6dca563d

[{'created': '2013-03-05 23:10:16.000000000', 'message': "Change the name of the project to oslo.config

Again discussed here:

  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-March/thread.html#6283
  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-March/thread.html#6138

The rationale is that the use of namespace packages is likely to
increase and there is apparently some consensus that the convention
should be to use period to separate the namespace package name from
the subpackage name - i.e. call it oslo.config. The zope.interface is
an example of this convention, but PasteDepoy is a counter-example.

Oslo is going to have a family of libraries, so it'd be much nicer if
they followed what the future Python convention is likely to be.

This is a disruptive change for packagers and the benefit isn't huge,
but pairing it with the also disruptive change to the versioning
scheme makes it somewhat more acceptable.

Change-Id: I63e96a8b48b166b07f1c8e79b6eaffb6234cc751

commit_message:
Change the name of the project to oslo.config

Again discussed here:

  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-March/thread.html#6283
  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-March/thread.html#6138

The rationale is that the use of namespace packages is likely to
increase and there is apparently some consensus that the convention
should be to use period to separate the namespace package name from
the subpackage name - i.e. call it oslo.config. The zope.interface is
an example of this convention, but PasteDepoy is a counter-example.

Oslo is going to have a family of libraries, so it'd be much nicer if
they followed what the future Python convention is likely to be.

This is a disruptive change for packagers and the benefit isn't huge,
but pairing it with the also disruptive change to the versioning
scheme makes it somewhat more acceptable.

Change-Id: I63e96a8b48b166b07f1c8e79b6eaffb6234cc751

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-05 23:10:13.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to semantic versioning

Discussed here:

  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-March/006283.html

The date based 2013.1 version is likely to be disallowed by PEP426
when it is ratified and we'll be required to treat the date based
version as a "private version" and use 0.2013.1 as the official
version.

Also, I'm coming around to the idea of using semantic versioning
(i.e. x.y.z) and increasing the major number when removing any
deprecated APIs. Th is the trend that Python is following according to
a discussion on distutils-sig.

One consequence of using semantic versioning is that we'll be very
loathe to remove any deprecated APIs since it will mean a version bump
from 1.y.z to 2.y.z. That's probably not a bad thing.

With this versioning scheme, I figure we should start with 1.1.0
(2013.1-2012). We'll increase the micro number when we do release from
the stable branch and increase the minor number with every coordinated
OpenStack release.

Change-Id: Ibe033d37742b82dee5f42d9e3d6a0b51582bd3ce
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to semantic versioning

Discussed here:

  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2013-March/006283.html

The date based 2013.1 version is likely to be disallowed by PEP426
when it is ratified and we'll be required to treat the date based
version as a "private version" and use 0.2013.1 as the official
version.

Also, I'm coming around to the idea of using semantic versioning
(i.e. x.y.z) and increasing the major number when removing any
deprecated APIs. Th is the trend that Python is following according to
a discussion on distutils-sig.

One consequence of using semantic versioning is that we'll be very
loathe to remove any deprecated APIs since it will mean a version bump
from 1.y.z to 2.y.z. That's probably not a bad thing.

With this versioning scheme, I figure we should start with 1.1.0
(2013.1-2012). We'll increase the micro number when we do release from
the stable branch and increase the minor number with every coordinated
OpenStack release.

Change-Id: Ibe033d37742b82dee5f42d9e3d6a0b51582bd3ce

[{'created': '2013-03-03 05:17:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed copy image to volume and clone volume.

This patch fixed the following issues in EMC driver found during G3 testing:
1. VNX array has two storage processors and it is doing load balancing when
attaching a LUN to a host. The storage processor used to attach a LUN to a
host is different from the one discovered by the driver sometimes, causing
Copy Image to Volume to fail.
2. The clone relationship is removed after a volume is successfully
cloned. However, this happens too soon sometimes before the cloned volume
is fully synced with the source volume.  The fix is to wait until it is
fully synced.

Change-Id: I5b8fab263723c47faf30b950a611c5bde7f29092
Fixes: bug #1135221

commit_message:
Fixed copy image to volume and clone volume.

This patch fixed the following issues in EMC driver found during G3 testing:
1. VNX array has two storage processors and it is doing load balancing when
attaching a LUN to a host. The storage processor used to attach a LUN to a
host is different from the one discovered by the driver sometimes, causing
Copy Image to Volume to fail.
2. The clone relationship is removed after a volume is successfully
cloned. However, this happens too soon sometimes before the cloned volume
is fully synced with the source volume.  The fix is to wait until it is
fully synced.

Change-Id: I5b8fab263723c47faf30b950a611c5bde7f29092
Fixes: bug #1135221

commit_message:
Setup device alias by device flavor information.

The router interface cannot be deleted since the MetaPlugin
cannot get the flavor information from the port which has
been deleted.
The solution is setting up the alias for each device based
on the flavor information, so the MetaPlugin still can get
the flavor information from the device itself even the
port has been deleted.

Also the router interface cannot be deleted since the
l3_port_check flag is not passed by MetaPlugin.

Fixes: bug #1085276

Change-Id: I670aa45c804e660ee4afb5359e0ab1347f369986

For the v3 api it is probably fine though. We currently, don't have any v3 tests in tempest though so it won't affect anything in tempest.

commit_message:
Update identity to handle '201 Created' response

Keystone bug currently returns 200 OK for POST requests when it
should be returning 201 Created. This change handles the pending
change in Keystone.

Keystone change:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/22600/

Change-Id: I982e03f1a7357f83a2c5af7852410c9cf0532ab2

commit_message:
run_tests.sh clean up

1. Re-organized script into three parts
 * function definitions
 * variable definitions
 * execution code

2. Removed redundant checks of "if [ $coverage -eq 1 ]"

3. Fixed running script as "python .//run_tests.py" if $PLUGIN_DIR is empty

4. Decouple noseopts and noseargs from NOSETESTS

Fixes bug #1146092

Change-Id: I2525b2c268a9749d35faa60cc8230e71089b3dc9

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-05 21:39:25.000000000', 'message': "Explicitly set ConfigOpts._args to sys.argv[1:]

Fixes bug #1146426

If you don't pass an args list to ConfigOpts.__call__() we pass
args=None down to ArgumentParser.parse_args() and it defaults to
sys.argv[1:].

However, in log_opt_values() we reference sys._args and you'd expect it
to show sys.argv[1:] in this case too but it shows None.

Fix this by explicitly setting _conf to sys.argv[1:] rather than relying
on argparse's behaviour.

Also add a test which would fail without this fix.

Change-Id: Id5a769bdda5f2359da18c301cb6305aaf3ed8617

commit_message:
Explicitly set ConfigOpts._args to sys.argv[1:]

Fixes bug #1146426

If you don't pass an args list to ConfigOpts.__call__() we pass
args=None down to ArgumentParser.parse_args() and it defaults to
sys.argv[1:].

However, in log_opt_values() we reference sys._args and you'd expect it
to show sys.argv[1:] in this case too but it shows None.

Fix this by explicitly setting _conf to sys.argv[1:] rather than relying
on argparse's behaviour.

Also add a test which would fail without this fix.

Change-Id: Id5a769bdda5f2359da18c301cb6305aaf3ed8617

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-03-05 20:47:30.000000000', 'message': 'Allow elements to include skeleton config

Copies all templates found in the root of any element into the
default template location.

These templates will be filled in from heat metadata by
os-config-applier whenever it is run.

Update keystone to install templates in this way as an example.

Change-Id: I0be0a79a431e9ba5b80e84f130c48d5ce8b100ae
Co-Authored-By: Tim Miller <tim.miller.0@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Allow elements to include skeleton config

Copies all templates found in the root of any element into the
default template location.

These templates will be filled in from heat metadata by
os-config-applier whenever it is run.

Update keystone to install templates in this way as an example.

Change-Id: I0be0a79a431e9ba5b80e84f130c48d5ce8b100ae
Co-Authored-By: Tim Miller <tim.miller.0@gmail.com>
